Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chanel1068
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival a very pleasant bell boy collected our bags from the car and was very nice and helpful with directions about public transport and locations! The staff at reception were also extremely helpful and did not make a fuss when we accidentally booked for a different date! Our view was beautiful across Hyde park from level 14 and the room was absolutely fantastic! It was very spacious, had a massive bath and contained a sink and microwave complete with a bag of popcorn in the mini bar! It was a great location just across the park from Westfield centre point tower and a $12 taxi ride from Darling Harbour! The buffet breakfast had a VERY impressive spread!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Siew Choy M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for several days in March 2012. I noticed that this hotel is getting beat up on Tripadvisor for having old rooms. We also stayed in an unrenovated room and I thought that people have really overlooked the other positive attributes of the hotel and have fixated too much on the age of the room. I really loved our stay there for the following reaons: 1. Room was very large with an expansive view of Hyde Park. One of the best locations in Sydney. Room also had a large sofa with coffee table, which was useful. The sink, microwave and a set of dishes also made it possible to eat in on occasions, thereby helping to save money in a very expensive city. 2. Room had a large bathroom with the biggest bathtub I have ever seen. 3. Location is great as mentioned by many others. Oxford Street is just behind the hotel for quick bites and some shopping. Just about all the major attractions are within walking distance such as Circular Quay, Botanic Gardens, the Opera House, Sydney Harbour Bridge, Darling Harbour etc. The subway to the airport and elsewhere is just 100meters across the street. 4. The pool and jacuzzi on the rooftop is just fabulous. The views from there were amazing and very few people compete with you for these facilities. 5. The staff were extremely helpful and accomodated all requests, including a late checkout. The only drawback is that the rooms are a little old now but I understand a refurbishment programme is underway. Look forward to coming back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: elzand5
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed at this hotel in Sydney. First of all, everything is very expensive in Sydney CBD , so be prepared ! This hotel is very well located , it is walking distance to almost everything. Circular Quay, where you can take ferries, bus , train... Queen Victoria Building, Darling Harbour , The Rocks, Opera House... Everything is close . We chose the Club rooms , and because our rooms weren't ready when we arrived in the afternoon, they gave us an upgrade , which was very nice, to rooms with Opera House View . Usually , in the Club/ Executive level rooms, they have amenities like slippers and robes in the rooms. Not in this hotel, unfortunately ... Breakfast was very good, and all the employees are always smiling. Concierge was very helpful too. All in all, very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: 17hinmi91
Reviews.Content: Currently staying here for 2 nights on a business trip - Deluxe room without breakfast. From check in to every small request the hotel staff reacted friendly and instantly. The rooms are a getting old a little (but nothing major or disturbing) but are very clean and well maintained. The room even has a water cooker, toaster and microwave. A big asset of the hotel is definitely the location...a 10 minute walk to Darling Harbor. A 20 minute walk to The Rocks. Both walks lead along the main shopping streets. Many restaurants and cares are close. To put it short, staff and location made me really recommend this location...the bed has the usually Marriott comfort. Parking is Valet...not sure of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Worst night in a Sydney hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hangaroundgirl
Reviews.Content: To say it was the worst night's sleep in a Sydney hotel would be incorrect. I didn't sleep at all. The pipes banged all night and the alarm next to the bed went off at 3.45am. The cost of the room was well over $300 so there was nothing about it that was value either. I complained about the pipes and got told ... don't you just hate this ..."no-one else has complained about this". So they agreed to give me a complimentary breakfast, not that I am a great fan of brekkie - I usually just have coffee and toast. So I explained this and asked for a skinny latte and was told that that would cost me $4.50. Insult to injury. So I said I'd just have a black coffee, I waited 10 minutes, when it arrived it was cold and bitter. Almost undrinkable. On speaking to my travelling companions in the morning, they were kept awake with the pipes too. I guess they just don't complain ... Its such a shame because this hotel is just across the road from my Sydney office and handy. But no point if one can't sleep. And I was even given an upgraded room.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel - excellent location and superb service!”
Reviews.Author: Gogo6gogo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights but felt that I'd had a week's holiday! Lovely pool, jacuzzi and gym area on roof level - open 24 hours!. Upgraded to premier suite with access to business and executive lounges. Excellent value with great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sunju
Reviews.Content: The room is nice,a bit small. Good location. We stayed for 2 night

Reviews.Title: “Great Accommodation Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hadley5892
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and found the hotel to be well located and in easy walk to all Sydney City has to offer. The room was spacious and well appointed with a terriffic view over Hyde Park, king size bed was comfy, overall very well maintained and clean. Only thing I would suggest is a tea towel and dishcloth as has a small kitchenette. Staff were also very helpful and polite. Would I stay again? .... Yes and thats the best recommendation I can give :)

Reviews.Title: “Ok but wouldn't return”
Reviews.Author: deliaowen
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few days mid week and although the room was nice and views of Hyde Park / City were lovely at night, there were some downsides: Television terrible to use, remote control slow to respond and some standard channels didn't work - I gave up after 5min and am very technological savvy. No plugs available in the bathroom - wanted to have a nice bath but it was late and I really couldn't be bothered asking room service. WiFi was good - managed to make FaceTime calls with very little lag. The in room safe was already locked with pin code (obviously not checked by room service) and once again, didn't want to call someone up at midnight to unlock it. I suppose for a hotel so big there's always issues with hot water but the shower (even at 5am) was hot & cold every 20seconds. It was like the whole hotel shared one hot water source! And finally the telephone handset on the bedside table, although hung-up, was continually buzzing! I ended up unplugging it from the wall and slept much better. It is quite dated inside, especially the bathroom and shower and I won't return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - shame about the lack of shade in the pool area”
Reviews.Author: I_Louvre_France
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently and I was a little bit disappointed. While the hotel is in a great location for Sydney - across the road from Hyde Park and within walking distance of lots of attractions - the hotel itself could do with a makeover. Wallpaper was falling off walls in the corridors and the lifts were slow and inadequate. One feature that was particularly disappointing for me was the pool area. The area itself has magnificent views out across the city and is an absolute attraction to the hotel in its own right. Unfortunately though there is zero shade provided by the hotel so as a result you can't spend a lot of time enjoying the space and it becomes very crowded later in the afternoon when the sun is less intense. Perhaps it was because it was a weekend and there could have been a lot of local tourists but I found it disappointing as I really wanted to enjoy the view and that was what attracted me to the hotel in the first place. On the flipside, my room was very comfortable. The bed was amazingly comfy and I had a small sitting area with a couch so I could look out over the city. My room also had a kitchenette panel with a microwave and a sink which would be very handy for anyone wanting to self cater. The bathroom was great too - very big with ample bench space. It is also located very near Oxford Street so dinner options were abundant.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location, Roof Top Pool, Glorious views of Hyde Park & City”
Reviews.Author: ByronVIPTravelWriter
Reviews.Content: I found check in was quick and easy with a friendly welcome by professional staff. I was delighted that I had been upgraded to a King Executive room, which has outstanding views of Hyde Park and the city, very large rooms with a cosy sofa and stunning bathrooms. The room have been recently refurbished, so the presentation was immaculate and dÃ©cor is modern and elegant, larger than many other CBD hotel rooms. The roof top pool has amazing views of Hyde Park, the city CBD and off to the East you can see all the way across Sydney Harbour to the Heads. Marriot has one of the few open air roof top pools. Although the pool is not heated, the temperature was beautiful, and was even comfortable to swim in at night. Plenty of room to sunbake, and relax in comfy laying chairs. Good protection from the wind by the large glass balustrade, and you can also take in surrounding views from the pool. Be sure to save some time to soak in the Spa Bath, which is inside but surrounded by beautiful glass panels, so you can still enjoy the vista of CBD lights. I liked that there is 24 hour access to the pool and spa, which suited me as I had a business function to attend to before getting back to the hotel but still could indulge in soaking in the bubbles before bed. Marriot Mini Bar prices are very reasonable compared to other luxury hotels, and one of only a few that provides a complimentary bottle of water. Marriottâ€™s location is superb, especially since you are directly opposite the beautiful Hyde Park, with bus and train stations across the road. You are practically on the doorstep of Oxford Street, so this would be an ideal location to stay for Mardi Gras or for trying the Oxford Street Bars, and Crown Street Restaurants. Its an easy walk across the park to the centre of Sydney CBD. Its also close to Surry Hills and a quick trip to Sydney Central Train station. So the Marriot has a great location for business, shopping, sightseeing, wining and dining. The Executive club has expansive views across Sydney Harbour to the east, and city CBD and Hyde Park views. The club is very good value and is priced better than many other CBD hotels. Thereâ€™s a large assortment of Complimentary Drinks, hot and cold food & nibbles in the evening. Thereâ€™s a fresh and enticing Continental Breakfast in the Exec Club, and a charming way to spend you morning, as you can see boats meander across the harbour. Customer service was consistently friendly, and nothing was too much trouble I fully recommend choosing Marriot as a preferred hotel for visiting Sydney and book a few days so you have time to experience the roof top pool & Spa, along with the sights of Sydney. I didnâ€™t have time to try the restaurant, lobby bar, or gym, but am sure to return to Marriot again.

Reviews.Title: “OK, HAS THE POTENTIAL TO BE ALOT BETTER”
Reviews.Author: Bambini08
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel for 3 nights for a city getaway with my husband and young son. We usually star at The Star, but we wanted to try a different city location (plus Star City's pool is closed, and we always stay in hotels with pools) having said that let me start with the pool. The pool absolutely needs to be drained and fixed, its clean but it has cracks and a lot of missing tiles, its on the rooftop which is nice, but its kinda drab up there, the hot tub has a note stuck on it saying "if button is broken please call #9 on house phone) which says basically the bubbles don't work and they didn't for us, but we didn't bother to call. The location of the hotel is great, overlooks Hyde Park and is close the restaurants, shops, bars ect. Our room had enough space for the 3 of us and the bathroom was large, the room felt clean, but the wardrobe stunk of someones BO which made us not put our clothes in there. Housekeeping was terrible, the hotel was not full, and each day our room was not cleaned till after 2pm, and I had to ask the housekeepers to do it, both times we went up to the pool so they could, but I must say we went out early and were back after lunch and it was very disappointing to come back to an unmade room. The room service food was awful, I will comment on this in another review, highly priced and bad!!! The Foxtel selections on TV were terrible, for international guests who would like overseas news there was no CNN or American Fox news, they had 3 sports channels and about 4 more very unthought about selections. They did have Nickolodean for the kids. Staff were ok, kinda cold, no warmth as you get in American Hotels. Anyway I will return for the location, and to give the hotel another go, but I won't order room service and I would love to see some work done on the pool area. Oh and heres the big complaint the pipes throughout our floor banged loudly day and night, well I hope it was just that floor and not the whole hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “the name doesnt say it all... tired tired tired”
Reviews.Author: hotwog4all
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the hotel, the lobby and staff were very impressive and oozed luxury city hotel. It was once I walked into the lift that I found it to be very dated and in desperate need of a refurb! Wood panels and mirrors - not the mod con feel. Upon getting out to my "upgraded" room floor I walked out to a fresh smelling floor which was better than the earlier lift experience. It was then that I entered the room and had quite a shock. Considering this was a random night in the city getaway from everyone and have some quiet time alone I wanted it to be slightly more than what I got. The room is set up in quite a strange way where the tv doesn't face the couch, nor the bed, but the balcony/terrace door. I chose to turn it towards the bed as the couch was quite dirty in appearance so it wasn't used at all. The terrace which I had was almost double the size of the room itself as well and felt a little daunting as I wax on the corner of the hallway and there was a door that could lead out to my terrace from there. Needless to say, the furnishings are extremely dated, bathroom tiles and set up very old. The corner bath is very big in comparison to others I have seen and reminded me of the large soaking tubs normally found in the US. Sound proofing should be looked at for the hallways as it was fairly loud out there as well. When Mirvac resumes looking after the property and rebrands I can only hope they complete the refurb as it would be a shame to leave the carpet, yellowing cyrtains and blinds, and the decor as it is. Good points though were the food which was available although the night menu could be expanded slightly. The staff who were attentive and made sure everything needed was taken care of as well. I look forward to returning to the hotel once its refurb has been completed to check it out once again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location.”
Reviews.Author: Terry00seven
Reviews.Content: We (2A 2C) stayed at the Sydney Marriott for 1 night on 24th March. The reason was proximity to the Art Gallery of NSW for the Picasso Exibition and it was the only hotel in Sydney that had availability at a good price. The reservation was made on the hotel website where we found a cheaper price by joining Marriott Rewards before the booking. The hotel is very close to the Museum train station (turn left when exiting) and the free 555 bus that stops adjacent to the train station. World Square Mono rail (be quick!) station is also less than 5 mins away with connections to Darling Harbour. A small convinience shop is around the back of the hotel of Oxford St and a Subway is 2 mins away on Oxford as well. Kings Cross would be 10 mins on foot and St Marys Cathedral and the Cook and Philip Pool are also less than 5 mins walk. We were upgraded to a Park View room (from City View) at check in.The hotel staff very friendly and efficient. We were also able to check in early which always go down well. There are 3 lifts, so not much waiting and you have to swipe the room key to get the lift to move. We were on the 18th floor in , allegedly, and updated room and the decor reflected this. Common areas (hallway etc) were in good condition, no peeling walls or dirty carpets but the lighting was subdued. Room was regular size for 2 doubles with a work desk and chair and 2 lounge chairs and coffee table. Bathroom was large-ish with large triangular bath and full width vanity. Large shaving mirror was a nice touch. Toiletries (soap/shampoo etc) were substandard for a hotel of this rating. The toilet seat was detached from the pan and had been for sometime, so I dont know what the cleaners are up to? The AC worked well and stayed on if you unselected "eco mode". The TV had a range of Foxtel stations but was difficult to actually get the TV to change stations and there were no instructions. The beds were OK, only doubles in our case so a bit bit small for 6 footers like us. Linens were very white and crispy. There was no discernable noise from the street, other rooms or the hall and the curtains were heavy black out, my favourite kind. Breakfast buffet on the first floor was adequate without being spectacular. Baked beans and hash browns are 2 of my must haves at a buffet and both were missing! All in all if you need to be in this part of town I can recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “outdated”
Reviews.Author: K_Toovey
Reviews.Content: I booked the Marriott Hotel on College St, East Sydney for a romantic celebration for my wedding anniversary. We bought the room through wotif and although it wasn't the most expensive room, the price was significant, and we assumed the room would be gorgeous. We were so dissapointed. The rooms are very 80's (not in a good way) and pretty depressing. All the furnoture is chipped and uber daggy. The carpet is ugly. The shower drips. The air con feels as thouigh its sucking the life out of you and the windows are dirty. such a shame when there is such a beautiful view. My husband visited this hotel 15 years ago and said nothing has changed. From the flickering hotel sign out the front with the plastic plants to the sad, empty bar, to the tiny over crowded and dirty pool area, we were really dissapointed. There are so many fantastic hotels in Sydney, and the Marriott needs a huge overhaul. We actually wished that we had save our money and slept at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, Tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: charles847
Reviews.Content: Tired hotel in poor repair, peeling wallpaper, moldy tiles in bathrooms... Very good location, walk to Anywhere you want to be, subway stop nearby, and beautiful Hyde Park. Very nice staff, helpful and friendly. Great Executive Lounge staff.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Hyde Park Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Tahuroa
Reviews.Content: Easy walking distance to CBD, buses, rail, opposite Hyde Park - Toaster and microwave in rooms

Reviews.Title: “great location, but hotel needs some updating”
Reviews.Author: BTay-Traveler
Reviews.Content: This was the eight time I've stayed at the Sydney Marriott Hotel on College Street and while I'll stay here the next time I'm in Sydney, it's getting to the age where they definitely need to start some fairly major updating if they want to continue charging the rates they do. Plus it's also in dire need of just some general maintenance--rmainly repainting the hallways due to the VERY numerous knicks and dings on the walls--most likely from careless guests and/or carts of both the bellmen and housekeeping. It's in a great location--within easy walking distance to Darling Harbor, Hyde Park, numersous restaurtants, bars and clubs on Oxford Street, the central business district, Circular Quay, botanical gardens and the Sydney Opera House. All of the hotel staff went out of their way to make the stay pleasant. The concierge at the front desk is a great contact for things to see and do both within the city and for day trips out of the city. You have to request nightly turn-down service--it's not automatic; however, if you happen to be in your room when housekeeping arrives, they simply hand you ONE bottle of water and 4 pieces of chocolate and leave without freshening up the bathroom, closing the drapes OR turning down the bed. Breakfast in the concierge lounge is good but VERY VERY basic, although they seem willing to order special requests for you if you ask--although it takes a while to get it sent up from downstairs. Pol and John in the concierge lounge are great--both have worked there for years and it's always a pleasure to see them again. There was also a new employee in the concierge lounge--Christine--who just moved to Australia from Ireland--she's VERY nice, personable, funny as well as professional--I hope she's still there the next time we are in Sydney. The only major complaint I have is the new thermostats for the air conditioners in the rooms--they apparently have some type of motion detector as when you leave your room for awhile, the a.c. unit shuts off and it's amazing to me how hot and stuffy the room is when you return--and unfortunately it seems to take forever for the room to cool back down to a comfortable temperature. I'm very hot natured, so I tend to keep the a.c. turned down very low--but that still didn't help. Plus, just about the time the room gets cool again, I would end up leaving again only to return to a hot room again--very frustrating for a supposed 5-star hotel to use this type of a.c. control in my opinion. All in all, it's a very decent hotel in a great location and with some general maintenance and updating, it can once again be a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not bad, not great”
Reviews.Author: further40
Reviews.Content: The hotel is shabby and dusty. Either the vacuum cleaners aren't up to the challenge or vacuuming is not a high priority in this establishment. The dust is evident on the carpet in the hallway on level 9, on the cupboard mirror doors, on the electricity plugs, The bathroom tap dripped. It didn't make a noise but the waste is disappointing. Good points are that the rooms are large, as are the bathrooms. Even though we didn't have a park view, the view over the back to Darlinghurst is fine. It is a better view than most hotels that offer a "city view. The windows open which is a nice touch for a Sydney hotel. We didn't try the catering. There are excellent cafes in Darlinghurst which avoid the need to sample hotel offerings. Would stay again if the price were right.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Service and Caretakers”
Reviews.Author: Annie O
Reviews.Content: While vacationing in Sydney my 80 year old father was in a car accident while on his way to meet us at the hotel. The staff was fabulous! They were so accommodating and caring. They went out of their way to make our family's experience as comfortable as possible considering the circumstances. I am a lifelong fan of Marriott and the kind people of Sydney because of the kindness of the staff at this hotel. P.S. The hot tub was very helpful too!

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable two night stay”
Reviews.Author: treetops41
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Staff were all very friendly and attentive. Room was very clean and had a lovely view overlooking the park. Only complaint would be that the walls appeared to be a little thin, so sleep was disturbed at times -other than this I struggle to think of anything negative about this hotel. In terms of location I travelled with my elderly mother, but we still managed the walk to Sydney Harbour attractions and then caught the hop on - hop off bus for a tour of Sydney, including Bondi Beach. Highlight for me was catching the ferry to Manley , which meant we not only got to visit Manley, but we got to see the beautiful coast line of Sydney without paying harbour cruise prices!

Reviews.Title: “pretty good overall”
Reviews.Author: NoNightSweats
Reviews.Content: excellent staff on entry, exit and in the restaurant. lovely john firth-smith painting in the reception area. the decor is a little old and tired - definitely needs renovating to bring it back to 5 star standard. position is terrific - had a park view room but the windows were pretty dirty. breakfast food was ok - had better at most similar places i've stayed in. it was the cheapest room in the area that night so i'm not going to complain too much.

Reviews.Title: “Average Sydney hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kramax
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel on business. I didnt choose to stay here myself and I probably wouldnt again. It is a hotel that does its job without the flash. A Travelodge standard. My bathroom was clean, though 2 long dark hairs were on the bathroom wall tiles. The room had 2 small double beds. The bed was not comfortable, but not the worst I have had. I woke a couple of times during the night, the mattress was soft. The TV was great, and offered great choices on Foxtel, unlike most other hotels. My room had a fabulous view over Hyde Park. I did not order room service, but the menu looked good. The room furniture is basically timber veneer, nothing flash. Water pressure is good. Shower was over a spa bath. security is good with access to floors requiring the room card. I am not going to unfairly bag this hotel, I was not paying and it is what it is. For me, I will be returning to the Sheraton on the Park etc for a bit more luxury. The business facilities were fantastic and the service offered was really good. My colleagues said the hotel restaurant breakfast was really good. Staff were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Park view”
Reviews.Author: Mikeandjennn
Reviews.Content: At breakfast beautiful park with large trees across street. Very nice way to start each day. Hotel within walking distance of Sydney Harbour Attractions! Not too close but walkable for those who are able. Lots of things to see on walk. Only criticism was breakfast buffet not the best, but still good.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, Dilapidated, Dumpy”
Reviews.Author: brmusicman
Reviews.Content: I was really shocked by this hotel. I stay in Marriott hotels very frequently and, in fact, chose to stay in this hotel in Sydney because the booking had to be made quickly, without the time to do much research, and I thought I could depend on Marriott delivering a high-quality hotel experience. In this case, I.was.wrong. This place is shocking because it is so far below the standards that the Marriott brand stands for. The main problem with this hotel was its condition: it is SORE need of a head-to-toe renovation. Let's start with the hallways, which were completely bland (gray, low-pile carpet with no pattern), dark, and had tons of damage to the walls -- dings from suitcases, black streaks, stained carpet, damaged signage. The room was no better: It featured a super-odd design with a oddly stocked kitchenette with dumpy old cabinets with damaged hinges and questionably clean flatware and a bathroom with a triangle-shaped tub which required a step system to enter as a shower (and a shower head placed so far to one side that water spilled out). In the bathroom, the tile was ancient and chipped in many places; years of dirt were in the grout. The shower 'curtain' was one thin piece of plastic -- basically, a liner only -- and the shower head was terrible. The basin was also ancient and the mirror was not clean. The room was no better. While the bed was comfortable, the duvet did not fit the mattress (it was made for a full bed and placed on a king). The headboard was dirty. The couch was dirty and had cushions with visible dents from years of sitting. The furniture in the room was chipped in multiple spots and the carpet showed tons of wear and tear despite being a deep green color. Internet access was spotty and slow. Overall, it was gross. The concierge lounge wasn't much better. It had a decent selection of food in the morning and evening, but equally cruddy decor. It was staffed, but the only thing the staff did was put out new food; there was no interaction with guests, no one offering you a drink, etc. Location was fine, but not great. The park views are lovely, and you have decent access to Oxford St. behind the hotel, but you are a good walk from Circular Quay and enough removed from the core of the CBD that most restaurants, etc. are a few blocks away. Overall, this was a terrible experience -- it was as if this hotel was built and its owner decided upon construction the place wasn't up-to-snuff and just decided to never touch it. It really was like stepping into 1989. It wasn't explained by a cheap room rate, either -- I've paid this much for other hotels in Sydney that offer FAR superior facilities and service. Very, very disappointing -- my advice is to avoid this dump unless the hotel should undergo a substantial (i.e., gut the place and start over) renovation. Yuck.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: sydneyc10
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as a Wotif mystery deal in late December for a one night stay. Unfortunately what was a pleasant stay at a decent hotel (wouldn't say a 5 star) was somewhat tainted by what I believe to be a problem with the deal included in the special mystery offer. The Wotif deal included "20% off all food and drink", and upon paying the bill on checkout was informed that this discount had been applied. I later realised it hadn't, and when I followed up was told it didn't apply to room service or minibar (fair enough - but this should have been disclosed much, much earlier). I was offered a refund of the discount, but had to chase this up at least 4 or 5 times before it eventuated - which became more a matter of irritation at the poor customer service, as the amount itself was minimal. Having got this unpleasant matter out of the way, the hotel was otherwise a fairly good experience. Obviously an excellent location; we got the train from Museum to Circular Quay (very quick, very easy), a very short cab to Belvoir St Theatre, and walked to the hotel from Kings Cross. The room was spotless, some parts looked a little tired, but a lovely view of Hyde Park (request a park view if you can!), and service was good. Beds were very comfy. Valet parking experience was flawless, and the room service food was delicious and well-priced for this kind of hotel. I'd rate it as a decent 4 star with a good location, but it doesn't stand out as a spectacular stay and my experience was slightly overshadowed by the query over the food deal. I wouldn't recommend it for a "special" trip, but for business or anything ordinary, it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: IdaChen
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband in the end of Jan. It's in the CBD area next to Hyde Park. A lot of bars and restaurants nearby, there are also convenience stores where you can buy daily stuff. It took us 20-min walk to harbour area. We got a room on high floor and we can see the park. We don't think it's a renovated room, but the room size is OK and the bath room is big, clean and functioning. There is a museum just 1-min's walk from the hotel, 5-min's walk to Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “First time at this property, wasn't disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ryandelany
Reviews.Content: Arrival/Lobby/Check-in I arrived at Sydney airport around 8am after a 14 hour flight from LAX and after a brief wait through Customs, Immigration, and getting my bag, I hopped on the train which was really convenient in the International Terminal. The ticket was $16.20AUD (which includes a fee for any trip to/from the airport) and I got off at the Museum exit which was 6 stops away. The whole ride took about 15 minutes. Exit at the Liverpool St exit and you are 1 block from the Marriott. The lobby was nothing special but was clean and they had ice water available to drink, and arriving so early in the morning I had no expectations of getting a room. I was just going to check my bags with the concierge, and go to the office for meetings. Fortunately, as a Marriott Rewards Gold member, they had a room available. I thought the check-in process was pretty quick and painless, except for the annoying Asiana Airlines crew that kept butting in front of me asking for plug convertors and such. Room I was given a room with a King bed (which I requested) on the 19th floor. Initially I was a little disappointed as I was very close to the elevator and I was given an adjoining room. Two things I can't stand. Luckily in my 7 day stay, neither turned out to be an issue. I never heard the elevator and the room next to me was either empty, or the people were quiet. I heard some TV noise the first day, but never heard it again. Overall the room was nice. It was obviously recently upgraded with a flat screen TV, new furniture, and the bathroom was remodeled. It had a giant tub (which I never used except to hang dry my workout clothes) and a nice glass-enclosed walk in shower. It also had a modern toilet and a vessel sink. The only real problem was that the drain stop for the sink was missing the clip that lets you pull it back out, so it was challenging to remove after shaving in the morning. The view was of Hyde Park, Sydney Tower, etc. and it was a very nice view. No complaints at all. The air conditioning worked great, although I could only set it down to 18.5C which ended up being ok. I usually like it colder. It was only a problem around sunset time because the window faces due west and the sun heated up the floor to ceiling windows which transmitted the heat in to the room. Easy to solve by closing the room darkening shades, but it did noticeably warm up the room a degree or two. Restaurants I never ate in the hotel restaurants, but we did have an event at the hotel during the week and the catered food which I assume came from the restaurants, was quite good. I did briefly look at the menu and overall the food seemed expensive, but not more so than typical hotel fare. There are tons of restaurants within easy walking distance, and a few really good ones down Stanley street which is 1 block north I believe. Gym The hotel had a gym, pool, and hot tub on the top floor of the building (23rd floor). I never worked out, but did go up and check it out. Standard set of equipment for a hotel gym. Treadmills, bikes, universal machines, etc. There were no free weights at all, and the gym didn't seem to be air conditioned at all, but otherwise seemed adequate. The pool was small, and the hot tub smaller, but you can't beat a roof top pool for the view! Admittedly I never used the gym because the location of the hotel was so conducive to great runs, I just ran outside all week. About 1.5 miles north is the Sydney Opera House and then it wraps around to the Royal Botanical Gardens. You would be a fool to run in the gym with so many nice routes that close. In bad weather or in a hurry though, the gym would be more than adequate. WiFi I got free WiFi as a MR Gold, but it was pretty slow most of the time. Considering it was free, I have no complaints, but if I had to pay for, I would be pretty upset. That being said, the signal seemed to work everywhere, and I was able to use the same account on multiple devices concurrently (laptop, iPhone, Kindle Fire) without issue. Some properties make you re-authenticate each device and only let you use one at a time, so this was a nice plus. I found out internet is pretty expensive in Australia in general, so this could explain the slower speeds, but it would be nice to have quicker internet for VoIP calls back home, downloading emails, etc. Executive Lounge I had access to the lounge on the 21st floor as a MR Gold, and it was very nice to have. They had a nice breakfast with typical western foods (eggs, sausage) along with a lot of great fruit choices (pineapple, oranges, passionfruit, mango, plums, etc.), and other options including charcuterie, pastries, an automatic pancake maker, toast, juices, etc. They also had a decent espresso machine that ground beans and made drinks to order. I used this quite often throughout my stay and it was accessible 24 hours/day. Additionally in the off peak hours, the lounge is empty so my coworkers and I were able to use it for a few hours for a meeting and we were never interrupted. There is a little couch area if you just want to relax and watch TV. The shame is that the view to the north used to really be great from the lounge, but they built a taller building right next door. You used to be able to see the harbor, the opera house, etc. and now you can see people hanging their laundry. No fault of the Marriott of course. Other observations One thing that was annoying was that I had some mini-bar charges show up on my bill. I don't know exactly what for (they don't give you details) but the front desk said it was for soda and water. It didn't take much to get it removed, and I normally wouldn't think much of it, but my coworkers also had mini-bar charges they shouldn't have had, which leads me to believe it's either a freak coincidence, or the hotel needs to have a serious talk with their housekeeping staff. I would venture to guess this wasn't an accident. The kicker was that I had access to unlimited soda and water in the Executive Lounge 24 hours day, so why would I take it out of the mini-bar anyways? This also wasn't the sophisticated Las Vegas style mini-bar where the fridge knows when you lift something up, it's just an old school refrigerator that the housekeepers count inventory in every day. Another issue I had was my room was never cleaned the first day I was there, although it was cleaned every day after that. I don't know if it's because I asked for it to be cleaned, or if this is standard operating procedure. They knew I was staying a week so maybe the planned to skip days? Not sure. They were also very inconsistent about replacing my towels. One day the bath mat disappeared, the next day they didn't replace the wash cloths. It was very strange. Maybe the 19th floor just needs some new housekeeping staff who don't erroneously charge people for mini-bar items, and who actually clean the rooms. Lastly, they are militant about check-out time and want to charge you $30/hour every hour after noon. I've never encountered that before, and fortunately I didn't have to stay that long, but thought it was worth mentioning. Don't even try to stay past noon unless you want to pay for the privilege. The strange thing is, they didn't even seem to service my room until after 5pm every day, so I'm not sure what the rush is to get you out of there. You clearly wouldn't be slowing down the housekeeping process by staying until 1 or 2pm. Summary Overall, I had a great trip and great stay at this property. I loved the proximity to the harbor, the train station, and the CBD. There is a ton of shopping, restaurants, and cultural things within easy walking distance. I walked to The Rocks, Circular Quay, Darling Harbor, the Opera House, Sydney Harbor Bridge, Sydney Tower, and Royal Botanical Gardens during my week at this property. I would stay here again if I had to, although there were a lot of other properties I would like to try out closer to Circular Quay, including another Marriott, a Four Seasons, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good Room.... not the worst”
Reviews.Author: Alcheringasailing
Reviews.Content: Went to this hotel for my wife's birthday There were some small faults with the wall paper in the hall way to our room and the furnishings weren't new but good quality It did have a proper king bed not two singles joined together and the room was large with a good view and quiet. The room was cleaner than some hotels we have stayed at in Sydney. The lobby was nice with a friendly greeting at the reception but the porter was only interested in helping good looking single females. The Gym was one of the best I've seen in a inner city Hotel with plenty of space and lots of equipment, the pool was only 12m long and the sauna worked well. Breakfast was very nice up to a five star standard this was the only meal we ate here. For the price we paid I would stay again as we got a good nights sleep

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel is marriott hyde park”
Reviews.Author: Beautymuse
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is uninviting. The hotel looks old. The reception staff including the manager clearly doesn't know what good customer service is. The room had paint falling off the ceiling. Poor airconditioning. And the WORST part is, they were charging is they were charging us for 2 fruit juices and pringles from the mini bar that we didn't even consume!! When we told the manager, he wasn't really impressed on us saying we didn't touch the mini bar at all. I swear im not coming back to this hotel ever again. Sydney has a lot of much better hotels worth the money. If you want a hotel near hyde park, there's hyde park inn, metro hotel or hilton.. Completely ruined me and my husband's wedding anniversary celebration.. Maybe if they change their staff that served us during our stay, it would be better

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, quiet, clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: HereOnHols
Reviews.Content: My review's title sums it up: nothing to fault with this hotel. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again ( in fact, I stayed twice in Jan).

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Ishakp
Reviews.Content: Ok so being in a long distant relationship i thought i would stay somewhere nice in town. Being a local sydney boy it was good to be a tourist in my own city. The Marriot is Nice and neat, very clean. The King bed was spacious and comfortable. The price tag hurt a little for the overnight, however i was not on any particular budget. The breakfast was beautiful, full selection. The staff were proffessional and happy. Would stay here again for sure

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant enough”
Reviews.Author: ILoveNYAustralia
Reviews.Content: Another secret hotel that we liked for the price. Nice view from our room (1115 ) of Hyde Park. Good location near Darlinghurst and Oxford Street. Shower in the bath but no hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable luxury!”
Reviews.Author: Cruzey
Reviews.Content: Previous reviews had me worried - needlessly! This IS a five-star hotel with a feel of class and luxury! My daughter and I had a few days in Sydney as a 'girly treat' and the hotel was a highlight- the room (on the 21st floor) was beautiful, the view across the park and city superb and room service dinner was delicious, presented well, hot and delivered by a gracious staff member. The beds were my favourite - huge, soft, downy mattress with high-quality sheets and duvet and masses of pillows - just delicious! Beautiful luxury bathroom with corner bath and shower over. Free wifi for Marriott members. All staff we encountered were helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Dated but doable”
Reviews.Author: Aldreta
Reviews.Content: Rooms are of a decent size, with huge windows allowing lots of light but not a great view. Easy walk to CBD. Lower levels are quite dated (stayed on 9th) but they were renovating higher levels during my stay. Interestingly, room has 2 electric hobs, kettle, toaster and a microwave if you did want to self cater. Old school corner bath a shower, but overall can't complain as stay was very comfortable and service very good.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location overlooking Hyde Park”
Reviews.Author: LM1227
Reviews.Content: Newly renovated luxury hotel across from Hyde Park and close to the Darlinghurst neighborhood. 30-minute walk to Sydney Harbour and 15-minute walk to Darling Harbour. Upgraded to beautiful, newly renovated room on 20th floor with access to Executive Lounge. Found the Executive Lounge to be particularly welcoming (the waiter named Pol was very friendly and accommodating) and well equipped. Rooftop pool and hot tub, fitness center, and gracious staff made our stay a delight. Highly recommend this hotel for business or pleasure visitors alike.

Reviews.Title: “Really beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paddyGrant
Reviews.Content: This hotel like most Marriott hotels I have stayed at was well above par, we were received very promptly upon arrival, we had booked 2 corner suites and we were not let down by the quality and cleanliness of the rooms, the views were perfect and the staff were magnificent.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded room, exceptional view”
Reviews.Author: LoveTravelAnytime6
Reviews.Content: With 4 adults and 2 children we stayed in 2 adjoining rooms that had been recently updated. One room had a king bed and a sofa bed, the other had 2 queens. The bathroom was moderate in size and had a fantastic separate shower. The rooms were quite large and very accommodating with a microwave and toaster. Service at the hotel was great, and Justin ? certainly made my kids feel at home by taking them to the kids area they had set up in their function room, and they provided nightly movies for the kids with pop corn and drinks!. This kids area was not supervised by hotel staff, so we stayed with the kids and had a great time watching Finding Nemo... The roof top pool and spa had wonderful views of the city and Eastern suburbs. The pool area is open 24 hours (WOW) but I found it very disappointing that at 10.00pm the kids wanted to swim and there were no pool towels available. I used the telephone within the pool area to ask for more towels only to be told they had "Run Out of Towels"..... I noticed 4 other people who arrived in the pool area after us make the same telephone call and were obviously told the same thing. This was very poor service, why have a pool open and not be able to provide towels. A sign should have been placed on the entry door to advise people to return to their room and bring their own bath towels. The only other issue was the breakfast line when we arrived around 8.45am, and were told they were full but they could call us when a table was available. We returned to our room and were telephoned about 15 minutes later to say our table was ready. Not a big deal, but we did make sure the next morning we phoned ahead. Once the refurbishments have been completed, I would love to return to this hotel. I hope all the rooms and bathrooms are as nice as ours were.

Reviews.Title: “flooded room ruined wedding dress”
Reviews.Author: jessie1001
Reviews.Content: we stayed here before heading to Thailand to get married, the room was very musty to begin with, then the floor vent backed up with sewage and proceeded to flow out the bathroom into the cupboard, quick thinking on my part was the only thing that didn't ruin my wifes dress completely, same can't be said for the veil, left standing in effluent my shoes were ruined, phoned reception, took about half hour to come up then they said they would clean the floor and we should stay in the same room, I refused and we got move to a room that smelt like wet dog, refused that room then finally got a normal room, which still stunk, appalling service and outdated rooms, up there with the worst hotels in Sydney, would rather stay in the backpackers!

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it unless you are willing to settle for 3 star rooms and facilities”
Reviews.Author: SunnieBrisbane
Reviews.Content: My husband, young daughter and O stayed here for 2 nights. Even though we paid a reduced rate through Wotif, it was still too much to stay at a delapitated hotel that unsuccessfully tries to pass itself off as a five star. The room on the 12th floor was old, with a tiny tv, which we had to turn the volume up on when the person in the room next door had a shower- it was that noisy through the wall! Room service food was terrible - far below the standard experienced and expected from a five star hotel. The room service staff were very nice though. The roof top pool is smaller than you will find in suburban backyards and has seen better days, with its missing tiles. The hotel location is good but it does not make up for everything else. We certainly will not be returning next time we are in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelRod
Reviews.Content: Right on Hyde Park and easy access to all the Sydney CBD has to offer. The hotel is a bit-no its very tired and in need of updating. My south facing view was nothing, some others were likely better. I will say it was a reasonable price at around 200AU$, half the price of Sheraton on the Park. Amenities are also a bit below Mariott standards. Some people talked about stunning views-that was not my room. And I am an upper tier Mariott guest, so usually they take care of me-not so much here.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like 3 star with poor amenities.”
Reviews.Author: AgnesHS
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms were small for 2 people and lacked the style and comfort one expects from the Marriott brand. Restaurant was closed when we arrived at 7p.m. because it was a Sunday. The hotel location is wrong side of Hyde Park, the area on the opposite side of Hyde Park is upmarket with plenty of sites worth seeing and excellent places to eat. The area immediately around this hotel is fast food and cheap accommodation. However once you know which direction to walk it only takes a few minutes to walk diagonally across the park. I would not choose this Marriott hotel again. Fortunately I have stayed in many Marriott hotels to know that this one is an exception. However if it was my first Marriott experience it would probably put me off the brand.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Marriott standard”
Reviews.Author: maltesegypsy
Reviews.Content: I have never had reasons to criticize a Marriott hotel but Sydney Marriott is not up to standard. Service and responsiveness of staff bordered on indifference. Executive lounge on the other hand had excellent service and little to no supplies. Very disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service, decor a little tired”
Reviews.Author: MissTipps
Reviews.Content: The title says it all really - if this is on your shortlist I don't think you'll be disappointed. Located right on Hyde Park, with stunning views of the CBD skyline and within walking distance of restaurants and Circular Quay. Very easy to park and only $25 to do so - we got to extend our parking after we had checked out too for no extra charge. We had breakfast included in our room rate, although a little disappointed to find that the restaurant was full when we went to breakfast and we had to wait for a table (never happened to me before)! The reception area is very welcoming and every single member of staff was polite and extremely helpful (even when I lost my ticket for the car park!) This hotel missed a 5-star rating because I found the decor and furnishing in our room somewhat tired (although I believe there is a refurb program in progress) and also because of the need to wait to have breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for a very good, centrally located, hotel”
Reviews.Author: denevans
Reviews.Content: This is a good value hotel in the up market segment. There are two Marriotts in Sydney both have nice large rooms. The Hyde Park hotel is considerably cheaper. The central location off Hyde Park can be very convenient. Service and cleanliness is excellent. The rooms are well appointed and large. The only negative is that the in-room internet is expensive and slow. They really need to improve this for business travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: Mlleruby
Reviews.Content: The Marriott on College Street is in a good position with fantastic views of the Park. If you are in a Park View room, this is where the stars lie. The star rating is not for the rooms which are tired and old. Although a large bathroom and massive spa bath, the ceiling was peeling and there was an odd door stopper right in front of the toilet which I managed to stub my toe on every visit. Also the bed was on wheels which moved whenever you sat on it. Minor but irritating. Plush carpeting in the hallways does not make a luxury experience overall. The staff were nice but there are much nicer hotels nearer for the high price. Room service meals were excellent and well priced. Free wi-fi too.

Reviews.Title: “Great renovation”
Reviews.Author: antipodienne
Reviews.Content: Last time I stayed at this hotel it was badly in need of renovation. While obviously based on some reviews not all rooms have been refurbished, I stayed on the Executive Floor and the rooms were finally at 'proper' Marriott standard. The bathrooms still sport the 1980s spa bath/shower combos that are rather distasteful given Australia's general need to treat water with care, but they're modern and clean. Everything else about the rooms has been updated to the highest Marriott standards. . The hotel is well located for an easy walk or short cab ride to the CBD, the lounge does a good breakfast and the staff are helpful, as one expects from Marriott. To be frank, I still think it's overpriced at rack rate ($300-$350/night) but much of the time it's possible to get better rates with advance booking.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely view, comfortable: needs some attention to detail.”
Reviews.Author: macsla255349
Reviews.Content: A colleague booked my accommodation here and I was looking forward to my stay as it is quite some time since my last visit here. Efficient check-in and the offer of a midday checkout was a great start [even though I couldn't take it up] as was the large room on 16th floor with a view over Hyde Park. The view was absolutely gorgeous at sunset and the city lights after dark very pretty. No traffic noise at all! There were two queen beds, a spacious bathroom, well equipped kitchenette and a small desk area. Unfortunately, neither the desk lamp nor the floor lamp worked; the floor lamp actually had a broken switch (the floor-type switch that you tap with your toe was smashed and broken bits just left there with the lamp still switched on at the wall) which I thought made it quite dangerous. The desk lamp needed a new globe which couldn't be supplied immediately - irritating as I needed to work. Some of the furniture was a bit worn, eg. it was noticeably worn along the edges of the desk and TV stand, but it was generally not new, still of a good serviceable standard and clean. Room service for dinner - there really isn't a great selection of room service meals for a place that has an in-house restaurant. That was a bit of a disappointment as I anticipated I could order from the restaurant menu and have it brought up by room service. I decided on a Marriott combo, which is a hamburger or club sandwich (@ $22) with beer or wine ($7-$10 by the glass for wine) and dessert is thrown in, which made it quite good value. It took two calls and absolutely ages for the "At your service" phone to be answered to place my order - this added a good 20 minutes to the process of getting my meal. Once ordered, the meal took about 45 minutes to arrive. In other words, it took more than an hour to get a hamburger and a dessert that only needed to be set up on the plate. Given that you don't generally order food until you are at least peckish and starting to get hungry, it was too long overall. However, the meal was indeed tasty and the dessert was fantastic. Check-out next morning was quite efficient. I would definitely return for another visit. The shortcomings are such that management could and should put housekeeping and room service processes in place to overcome. Then it could be "excellent" rather that just "very good"!

Reviews.Title: “The $12 on-the-go brekky is great!”
Reviews.Author: raura
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night on business. Bit hard to get to with all the one way streets but once there, a breeze through check in. Parked the car in the overnight parking underneath the hotel. Fair value. Room itself was nice, not super modern but comfortable. Great bed. Gym on site was excellent, both cardio and weights available. Location overall very close to Surry Hills/Oxford Street and the city. The best bit was the $12 on-the-go breakfast. Order it, pick it up 20 mins later. Large coffee, two muffins, apple and bacon and egg muffin. Wow!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Spacious”
Reviews.Author: Steve8010
Reviews.Content: Very spacious rooms - including lounge chair and actual king bed! The bathroom was roomy with separate shower and bath although the water pressure in the shower was abysmal. Location is excellent and the views over the park are superb. Bed was extremely comfortable, housekeeping were very efficient and friendly and reception staff were pleasant. Some of the furnishings could be updated to bring it up to a standard of excellence. Would recommend for a first rate stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Built for Comfort, Not Speed”
Reviews.Author: Vinylstatistics
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel, but lacking a little sparkle. It does what it says on the tin. Reception very helpful and room spacious but tired. Bathrooms lack the feeling of oppulence that is achieved in other Sydney hotels. Very clean, excellent gym and a first rate location - but lacking soul

Reviews.Title: “A great weekend away”
Reviews.Author: myreviews76
Reviews.Content: We regularly stay at this hotel when we travel to Sydney. The location is great being close to shops and restaurants with a beautiful park across the road. We stayed in a newly refurbished room on the Executive level. The room is very modern and has all you would expect after a refurbishment. The Executive lounge breakfasts and evening canapÃ©s were first class. Well done Marriott we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Steve L
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sydney Marriott for almost 4 weeks. I wanted to name those people who most helped make my stay enjoyable: Vivek Singh - learned my name immediately and used it each time he saw me. Also often connected with me by smiling or nodding "hello" across the lobby. Elizabeth and Oleysia behind the desk, both used my name often and had a friendly smile. There were others too whose names I did not learn. Jose (concierge) was super helpful contacting Virgin Airlines for me and with other assists. Lucas was very friendly and helpful too. I didn't see much of Grant this trip, but he was very helpful and pleasant during my May stay. Jacob in the 21st floor lounge learned my name right away and was very fun and personable. Pol greeted me after a while and would stop to chat. I don't know the name of the man with the great smile and sweet manner on the 21st floor for breakfast, was great too. All-in-all it was a great stay. Thanks. :::

Reviews.Title: “Great Team!!”
Reviews.Author: Klipvissie
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Sydney recently, having stayed at Sydney Marriott Hotel. I am extremely pleased that the staff there especially Ben Smith, the Front Office Manager and other member of his staff have made my stay there very pleasant, comfortable and very enjoyable. The other members of staff that have been very helpful and caring are: 1) Micheal Bailey â€“ Duty Manager 2) Toby Cornwell â€“ Window Restaurant Manager 3) Imogen â€“ Window Restaurant staff member 4) Sian Lian Lee â€“ Club Lounge Assistant. Glad that I choose to stay at Marriott Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Stay away! More like a 2 star motel rather than a 5 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ChiNyLon
Reviews.Content: Summary: This is the worse Marriott experience my husband & I have ever had. The level of service and quality of the rooms are more in line with a 2 star motel than what you would expect from a Marriott. The long story: We arrived late (10pm) at the start of our 4 night stay and were placed in a musty motel like room. The carpet smelled and the furnishing & decor looked like they were from the 70's. The room felt & smelled dirty overall. My husband was particularly bothered by the fact that he couldn't use the toilet without holding up the toilet seat because the bathroom floor was slanted and it wouldn't stay up on it's own. We couldn't get on the Internet for a day because they 'exceeded the number of users'. When we called 'at your service', we waited about 30 rings before someone picked up. They explained that technicians were working on the problem so we asked them to call us back as soon as it was fixed. We were never called back that night. In the morning, we called again only to be told that the technicians don't work the same hours as they do in the hotel and won't be in till 8:30-9am. They added that it wasn't the hotels fault, but the providers fault for not allowing them to increase the number of users. We were appalled that they were giving us an excuse and placing the blame elsewhere! In our opinion, for a hotel in a world class city such as Sydney to have that problem is a poor reflection on hotel management. If you happen to be a Marriott Platinum member, don't expect to be treated any different. The front desk never bothered to give us automatic access to the executive lounge, even when we told them we were platinum members at check in. We had to go back downstairs and ask for a new set of card keys. We were so fed up that we finally requested to speak to a manager the next morning, the general manager was not available so we dealt with the 'on duty' manager. He tried to make amends by moving us onto a higher floor but said that they are at capacity and didn't have anymore refurbished rooms. Apparently only about 2 out of the 22 floors or so are refurbished. We ended up with the same motel like room on a higher floor with the same musty carpets. I desperately wanted to switch hotels but with only 3 full days in Sydney and so much to see, we just didn't have the time to deal with it. We loved Sydney but the hotel experience put a huge damper to an otherwise amazing trip. I am hoping to warn others not to make the same mistake as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Emeste22
Reviews.Content: Sydney Marriott is not up to the standard of other Marriott properties and has a very run-down, shabby and neglected appearance. The room I was allocated lacked sparkle and freshness. The furniture was very dated and cheap quality. The bathroom had cracked tiles and is in desperate need of a total revamp. My experience with this hotel was disappointing and let's the otherwise good brand name down. Membership to Marriott Gold is poor value and gave me no privileges at all. The staff were pleasant and did make the excuse that the hotel would be undergoing redevelopment in the future. I will wait until then before choosing toi stay at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great until....”
Reviews.Author: spwopw
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute mystery deal for a weekend away with the family, and was well worth it. The location was perfect - opposite Hyde Park so it was an easy walk to the Opera House, Circular Quay and the Rocks. Check in was very easy and we were offered a room upgrade on arrival and so enjoyed a great view of the park. The room was very well appointed with a huge shower and bath, and the 24 hour gym and spa with a view was a real feature. Room service menu and food quality was good, but it was a pity that they didn't quite remember all of our order - twice! The breakfast buffet quality and staff were exceptional, but the whole experience was let down at checkout when the staff member became quite blunt when we queried the credit card surcharge. How quickly a good experience turned into an unpleasant one. On the whole, a worthwhile stay, and would be a very suitable business stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “very dated rooms but great service”
Reviews.Author: Debra255068
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott with a mystery night bought on lastminute.com.au The location was not not thrilled at first as it was advertised as CBD location. Its not. But the best bit is that its next to the beautiful park. Its near oxford street. I found really handy to get to the north shore and linking up to the motorway. The room had forest green carpet with bad tiling in the bathroom. The walls have been painted but the walls are rough. The worst bit was I near the fire exit and the staff could use the stairwell and smoke. This would come through the ducts as I turned off the air con. The bed sucks and should be thrown out. My feet also got bites all over them - don't know from what!! as the windows do not open. You can hear the neighbours through the walls and they kept me up until 3am. I finally rang the front desk and complained. So I looked scary when I had to work the next morning. Room service took 47 minutes and I had to follow up. Placing the order they did not answer the phone at all. I rang back and had to let it ring 20 times or more. Front desk service was excellent and car parking at the front was quick and friendly. The hotel is owned by Mirvac. They are not known for spending much on their properties. I would have not booked if I knew they owned it. The view was lovely from the windows. They charged $220 for this room that included internet access if you join their Marriott club (free).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent views of the city and super cool top floor”
Reviews.Author: fhdz81
Reviews.Content: I loved it. The views from my room were priceless and the room was spacious and comfy. Marriott doesn't look like a greedy hotel that charges for everything as they have Internet for free for rewards members ( you can join online ). They also have affordable express breakfast to go. Breakfast is delicious and with so many options. The pool, sauna, hot tub and gym in the top floor are simply fabulous. Working out with that view is a pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “BED-BUGS! What a dissapointment-Marriott should drop this hotel from its list!”
Reviews.Author: MrRelaxing
Reviews.Content: Wow, where to start on such a terrible review! It pains me to write this being both a Marriott member and an owner in their vacation club program. The hotel is not up to the level of service one deserves when staying at a Marriott. What even impacted me more was the level of response and service I received from the location managers and even the regional operations manager. When one takes the time to meet with and then call the head honcho of the region and then he (David) never follows-up your call it really demonstrates the lack of service you would expect at a name brand like this. One of my travel companions caught Bed-bugs across the whole body during the stay so be aware to check your room as best possible. The bites were across the whole body and even after 2 weeks the bites are still visible with now everyone worrying about scarring. When confronted with this, an email reply was all that was sent. Even after raising this with the operations manager. On top of this the daily food service was downright poor in the main dining room. Getting the bills wrong and charging everybody and then checkout further arguing with us at checkout that we were incorrect, only to finally realize their mistake. Breakfast for our group also was delayed and some never even received their orders after 30 minutes. I was surprised how the buffet area food was pretty much empty and was not replaced during the time I was in the room. When I confronted the breakfast manager about this all I got was a "sorry". My room that I was using was also so cold they had to get the engineer to turn on the heat and even then took over 2 hours to correct. The staff were also surprised how long it took. I guess the whole experience was really jaded by the response from the management at the hotel. I will never visit or recommend that location again and am loathe to recommend the other Australian locations due to the poor service provided the head of regional operations. The level of service was commensurate with that of a $49 a night motel and not to mention the final insult of the bed bugs! There are a lot of other hotels in Sydney that I would now consider and recommend to others coming to stay! Be wary!

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: knockitdown
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night to celebrate my partnerâ€™s birthday. I remember making a note about a birthday stay during reservation, but received no room upgrade, no special treatment whatsoever. A little disappointed given its Marriott & Iâ€™m a Marriott reward member. Check in was swift & efficient. Delighted to get a room on the upper floor as requested. Comfortable king bed with never-too-many-pillows. It has a magnificent view overlooking Hyde Park. Bathroom is equipped with the minimum basics, you would expect more from a 5 star hotel. Bath robes & slippers were nowhere to be found, though room service were more than happy to deliver it to us. We spent some time checking out various facilities in the hotel. Even a better view of the city from the roof top! Gym is extremely well equipped & maintained. roamfree.com.au mentioned â€œoutdoor heated swimming poolâ€�. No, it is ice cold, that misleading information needs to be addressed. Had a full Australian breakfast at the Windows restaurant the following morning. Pretty good selection to choose from, thoughtfully presented, service is attentive. The self-service pancake machine is no doubt fascinating, though I canâ€™t imagine the wait if the restaurant gets packed. The property sits on a good location. 5 minutes walk to museum train station, 10 minutes walk to world square.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nikkipie89
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in August. There really isnt anything to complain about, its a nice hotel and has good views. Marriott Circular Quay is much nicer view wise but its more expensive so this is a nice alternative! Staff were friendly and the beds were comfy and clean. Reccommended.

Reviews.Title: “Business Conference at The Sydney Marriott”
Reviews.Author: JoandJim
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I recently stayed at the Marriott for a week long conference. The facilities were great and the hospitatlity staff were amazing. Especially the night crew in the restaurant and the front bar. (Unfortuantely we cant say the same for the check-in staff who were robotic and impatient). The food was great and the facilities were wonderful. The location is very central you could easy walk to the centre of town or to transport to everything else. The rooms were more than comfortable and the views over Hyde Park were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Mystery Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annie M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on Saturday night as a treat to my daughter as we had a night out. The view over Hyde Park was amazing. The location is fantastic. That is it. I choose valet parking and had to remind the attendant twice to bring everything in from the boot of the car. Then even as we were checking in we noticed he had left a bag in the boot and had to remind them again. The Duty manager checked us in and asked us if we wanted to upgrade and said we would love the room if we upgraded so much better than the one we had been allocated even though we already had been upgraded in the package. We checked out the room it was on a higher level and honestly it was exactly the same size as the one we had booked. It had been refurbished & it was very masculine.( did not love the room at all) The bathroom had the same fittings they had retiled and did a few changes, nothing major. For us it was not worth the upgrade. If you wanted to have canapes in the evening and access to the executive level for breakfast then it probably would have been worth the $120 upgrade. Our room was very old and I thought clean at first appearance then I noticed there were 2 spots of stains on the bed cover and the room was dusty and the mirror wardrobe had smear marks all over from bad cleaning. The bed was comfortable. Every Five star hotel I have stayed in always have bathroom supplies of ear buds, shower caps, sewing kit etc. This hotel supplied only soap & shampoo & condition in the bathroom. It was a very noisy hotel in that you could hear anyone outside the room and the cleaners early in the morning woke me up outside our room. I found the hotel extremely tired and am shocked that it is classed as a Five star hotel. My daughted and I were extremely disappointed and so glad we chose not to upgrade. We did not try the food.

Reviews.Title: “Functional & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Smiggle11
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed overnight at the Sydney Marriott. Given the short stay, I certainly can't provide feedback on every aspect of the hotel. What I can tell you is....... Valet Parking - we used this alternative as it was only marginally dearer than self park and all in all pretty good value compared with the inflated parking fees that many hotels are now charging. Our valet gave the kids a chocolate each which was a nice touch. Check In / Check Out - Friendly, courteous and efficient on both ends of the stay. No complaints whatsoever. The Room - The view over Hyde Park was certainly impressive. The beds were comfortable, enjoyed a nice quiet stay. My only criticism is this - given we are talking Marriott here (and I notice some other reviews have commented along similar lines) some of the furnishings are badly out of date. I've attached a picture of one of the sitting chairs in our room - to be honest it was worthy of a backpackers (not that I have anything against backpackers - indeed some would probably knock back this standard of furnishing). The cabinets were tired, marked and chipped. The tiles in the bathroom were looking a little the worse for wear. Don't get me wrong - minor criticism's and would happily stay again. Just need to update in keeping with the well established Marriott name and brand.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: travelbugforever
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for one night at this hotel. I had a deluxe park view (it overlooks Hyde Park) Whilst a good size room overall the bathroom is in need of updating. Still had a shower curtain! Bed was comfortable with a nice selection of pillows.I did have a meal in the bar(the restaurant was booked out for a function) and that was quite nice. I think the plus is the close proximity to the city centre. I walked across Hyde Park in about 5 mins and was in the centre of the city in about 10mins so ideal base if a tourist. I found the staff polite and friendly and met me at the taxi to take my bags and called one for me when leaving and placed my bags in the taxi.The hotel is nothing to write home about but if you can get this hotel for a good price then I think it is worth staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Only a 4 star hotel but with 5 star views of Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: travelmumSydney
Reviews.Content: Not the 5 star rating as expected. The deluxe park view room which we booked was dated, however it was clean and the bed was comfortable On first entering the room it had a smokey/stuffy smell - even though it was supposed to be a non-smoking hotel. Luckily the smell somewhat lessened when air conditioner was left on for a while. The room was fairly spacious with sofa, desk and built in cupboards. Also handy was a small kitchenette with a microwave, crockery, cutlery and wine glasses - good for the odd take away meal or champagne and cheese platter before heading out for the evening. Would be really lovely if/when the room is redecorated and modernized a touch. The bathroom was clean and with a large shower/bath, only limited bath accessories were provided -eg. body wash, shampoo and lotion and a well used hairdryer - no slippers or robe. If you want a romance package - pick elsewhere or upgrade to the club suites @ $100 extra. Apparently only some rooms (club/ suites) have been renovated recently. Check in / out was efficient and friendly with Elizabeth. The room allocated to us was on the 18th floor and had amazing views across Hyde Park and the city skyline - particularly at sunset and with the evening city lights - Sydney sparkled to its best!! We decided to have breakfast at the hotel which was ample, but lacked anything special. Omelets prepared fresh- which was nice. At $34pp, better to find a nice cafe in town or walk to cafes in the parks nearby. Very central location -short walk to shops, Hyde Park and Art Gallery. Museum of Sydney few doors down from the hotel. Good for a short stay or if you find it at a good last minute rate as I did. Parking for in-house guests is $25 day which is good for Sydney hotels.

Reviews.Title: “nice reception area, room a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: DZY969
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott on business for a couple of nights. The reception area is very nice and there is a sort of lounge area to the side that was really useful for meeting people. Coffee shop was upmarket and the all staff on the front desk were friendly. The actual room had a small kitchen area with microwave, toaster and kettle. The room was clean but looked a bit dated, doors that were once white looked a bit yellow and looked like they had hundreds of layers of paint on. Flat screen TV was big but had a poor picture quality on several channels. All the Gym equipment looked brand new and the spa/pool area was of a very high standard. The pool and gym are on the roof and so overlook Hyde park. As a Marriott Silver card holder you get free wifi but if not then it was very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Almost 5 stars, just wait for the renovations and we'll see.”
Reviews.Author: LorieNakasenh
Reviews.Content: Ok usually when I have a good stay, I cant wait to come on here and write a review about it. So today is the 28th September 2011 and Ive stayed here on the 17th September 2011. Which is 11 days ( not that you guys cant count) To be honest Ive jumped on here many times and been meaning to write a review but I just couldnt. Not that the stay was heaps bad but I so badly wanted to find that wow factor and give this hotel as much chance as possible. So now as I sit here thinking and looking back. When you enter this hotel, yes it was clean, yes it was professional, lobby is nice but it doesnt have that wow factor. By the way my friend had booked this for our sort of hens night out while the boys were on their bucks and it was just me and her considering we are bestfriends. Anyways thats beside the point, now as you enter and head towards the front desk you do notice a massive sign stating that the hotel is due for some major renovation works and some sample photos what it would look like in the future. By the way when I walked in with a luggage I did notice no one came and actually asked if I needed help but than again I did not give any eye contact and just headed to the lobby and waited for my friend.And there thats when I started taking happy snaps of the lobby and 2 minutes later one of the front desk people came over and adjusted the pillows on the couches, guess cause he saw me taking pictures.
