Check in was fast, which was good, headed to the rooms, views werent that great, room decor was outdated, so was the bathroom, BUT i must say the beds were comfy, not hard as rock and cheap. Good to see they invested in soft luxury beds. We got a room with a massive king bed which was good and yes the room was very clean. The only thing is they didnt have foxtel. Look there was nothing bad, it was just simple and efficient but right now if your looking for a nice luxury place, this isnt the place to go. But after the renovation who knows? I say good for business travels. Hotel is right in front of Hyde Park and a short walk to busy George Street. My friend paid $349 cheaper than what other 5 star were offering at that time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, accomodating & friendly staff; executive floor access fantastic”
Reviews.Author: barbara_b12102
Reviews.Content: I booked the Sydney Marriott for a work related meeting so used the guest rooms and catering services. After arriving on an overnight flight from the US, my room wasn't ready (9 AM) but I was invited due to my Marriott status to get breakfast in the Executive lounge. I took advantage every day of the cheese and meat assortments, hot breakfast items, fruits, pastries, etc. The servers were friendly and helpful, and wonderful views of Sydney from the 21st floor. My colleague & I also visited the executive lounge each evening before heading to dinner, for a great selection of drinks & hot & cold appetizers. The service for the meeting was punctual, food was tasty and had great reviews from the local meeting attendees. Any issues (ie room temperature) were addressed immediately. Hyde Park across the street made this a very convenient location and a great place to walk in and from; 30 minutes or less walk to most of the Sydney sights.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay marred by occasional bad service”
Reviews.Author: ST_ray_BJ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely, central overlooking a park and close to p ublic transport. There is a rooftop pool with great views of the city and a heated jacuzzi indoors, not to mention a gym on that level with great views again. My room was a good size and very comfortable. Unfortunately, the receptionist service was terrible twice -- on arrival and on departure, leading to my sponsor getting double-charged for my airport transfer (and to this date we have still not received our refund for airport transfer)!

Reviews.Title: “Facing the park”
Reviews.Author: SFreeman61
Reviews.Content: This is an efficient and pleasant hotel providing a comfortable stay and good service. As someone who stays in Sydney regularly, usually in the heart of the CBD, i enjoyed the easy proximity to the city and having floor to ceiling views over the park. A walk through Hyde Park to start your day in meetings is a bonus. Its also a handy area if you wish to try any of the many great restaurants in the Surrey hills and the Darlinghurst area.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Niels_Maaike_NL
Reviews.Content: Over a period of 3 week business trip I stayed a couple of nights at this hotel. Asa any marriott; good service, great room, clean, friendly etc. Although the location is not as close to the harbor as the other marriott, it is a very nice walk through the park to the harbor. They have an excellent gym, with a very nice view and the breaksfast is good too. All in all, not a bad place to stay when you are in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality Hotel, But Lacks Any "WOW".”
Reviews.Author: MPCLDC
Reviews.Content: Marriott Sydney is a good quality hotel, very clean, helpful staff, in a safe location walking distance to the harbour. The hotel does not have any "WOW", the lobby is average, the rooms are average, the breakfast is average. For business travel on a tight budget, Marriott is ok, if looking for a good experience go for Sheraton on the Park.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but very ordinary service.”
Reviews.Author: morrisseykj
Reviews.Content: In a city such as sydney with a large range of choices for hotels and accomodation i would have though hotels would try and define themselves with superior customer service. This was lacking at the Sydney Marrott hotel. The hotel situated right on hyde park and next to oxford st, close to westfield sydney and near the city circle train line. So great location. Sadly, on arrival we were about an hour and ahalf early for check in but the reception was not busy at all. They informed us our room wasn't ready and we needed to come back. They offered for us to pay for a room upgrade to the rooms which were ready but we delcined. We had to ask for them to hold our bags at which they made it out as some form of effort. We came back 10 mins before the recommended check in time and they still didn't have our room ready and asked us to pay for a room upgrade if we wanted to check in. Very poor service. if there were rooms for us to be upgraded to if we paid, why did they not just upgrade us for free and asave the hassle. This set us on a bad experience with them for our 2 night stay. Both mornings at breakfast, they asked us to move before we had finished breakfast so that other people could get in as they did not have enough room. Just very ordinary for a hotel with a good name.

Reviews.Title: “Professional, friendly and good food”
Reviews.Author: BrianMcGinn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business conference and found the food and rooms to be great. It was real nice to be able to go for a nice walk around the park (located) direcly oppositie the hotel after and before meetings

Reviews.Title: “just ok all round..”
Reviews.Author: bettyluvstravel
Reviews.Content: Accomodation older style, around 10 mins walk to chinatown, 1st room smelt terribly of mould, and after calling reception, we were swiftly moved. This was great but our booking had also come with an upgrade, after a 3 hr drive we just wanted to sleep, not have to change rooms again so didnt bother complaining again. Room service dinner great, check in and out no problems. Definately much better value elsewhere in sydney.

Reviews.Title: “great location but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: peely95
Reviews.Content: We always try and stay at a Marriot as we are members and can usually expect a certain level of satisfaction , but this hotel is really nothing special. It is in a good location for the city centre but i think its getting a little bit tired . Could do better !!

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: bobborn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a solid choice for business or tourist stay. I prefer it to the Harbour hotels because it is away from the chaotic traffic but still close enough to get to a variety of venues. (e.g., a $4.40 return ticket on the subway gets you to Circular Quay, or you can walk it in 20-30 minutes). It's also near an access point to the Eastern Distributor if you're driving to North Sydney or beyond. Location isn't ideal for any one point of interest, but it isn't far away from anything, from Circular Quay to Morningside Harbour, to Surrey Hills and to Kings Cross. I disagree with other reviews that call the rooms "tired" and in need of a refurbish. I stayed this time on the 19th floor and had no complaints. I was delighted to find that the room had not only a coffeemaker and small fridge, but also a microwave and a toaster. My first task when I arrive is to walk across the park to the nearest convenience store and buy some snacks and bread for a quick in-room breakfast. An alternative is the room service breakfast which is ordered the night before and delivered at the time of your choosing. An egg & bacon sandwich with a cappuccino cost about $20. I also disagree that the $25 parking charge is reasonable, but it is what it is. I've paid the same in Los Angeles but still gripe about it. The staff is always friendly and helpful and the room has more pillows than you can possibly use. It helps to be a Marriott Rewards member ( they waive the internet charges), so join if you already haven't. It's a great base for exploring Sydney, my favorite city in the world outside the USA. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Most likely i will stay here again next time”
Reviews.Author: gaganahuja
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and excellent staff. I was disappointed that Bar food had very few choices. Hot breakfast was $34 but then son i discovered entire Sydney was crazy like expensive. I rented the car on first day to drive up to Blue Mountains ...it was fun driving on wrong side of the road. City driving was also fun. The hotel is very conviniently located in front of a big park. In daytime, i would walk thru the park to my office in business districit with coffee (Aussie coffee cups are kids size!!). In evenings i would walk on opposite direction where they had all bars and other good stuff. Everything is walking from this hotel. Best part of the clean room with flawless city views. I would have given them 5 star if they had better selection in bar food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: safitz
Reviews.Content: We found the best rate online and could not fault the location or service received. Any little problem was efficiently handled by the staff. Location was opposite Hyde PArk in Sydney with public transport a short walk away

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: BobbyGAus
Reviews.Content: First time at this Hotel which we booked through Wot-If "Mystery Hotel" site. When the Hotel was displayed I was a bit disappointed due to the location on the Eastern side of Hyde Park but it was a breeze to access and parking is reasonably priced at $25 overnight. Our room (8th Floor) overlooked Hyde Park and the view of trees instead of buildings was soothing and not claustrophobic. The room was quite large with a King and pull out sofa bed.. Bathroom was a good size as well. TV reception was a bit ordinary and had not been set up for digital. The picture was stretched. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. We are Marriotts Rewards members so wi-fi was free. The signal strenght was a bit wishy washy varying between 1 bar and 2. Just acceptable. But, overall, good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant service”
Reviews.Author: jemGoldCoastOz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sydney Marriot Hotel earlier this month. I was with my Daughter and Niece for a "Girls Weekend ". The location of this Hotel is great. It's within walking distance to all of the top spots you want to see as a tourist in Sydney. On arrival we were checked in by Ben Smith. I must say this young guy was very courteous and most professional which was a pleasant surprise as I have found with the bigger Chain Hotels most of the time you are treated as just a number. Thanks Ben ! Feel free to ask any questions. Jem

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kim10_2010
Reviews.Content: Don't mix this Marriott up with the Marriott Harbour as this one is a train/bus ride away from everything. Excellent hotel in a very nice area, near the Museum train stop with lots to do and see nearby but not near the harbour. Staff was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “friendly support”
Reviews.Author: polly54_11
Reviews.Content: My 84year mother and my sister and i decided to have a sydney escape to visit family and have a treat. The help of Justin Maynard was outstanding and made our 4 night stay very pleasant and friendly. Nothing was too much trouble for him to assist us from showing me how to work the Nav system in my borrowed car to giving advice for dining options. It makes such a difference when you feel you can ask for help or advice without feeling that you are demanding. The marriot has a great person in Justin thankyou

Reviews.Title: “The rooms and bathrooms are tired.”
Reviews.Author: ManFromLondon186338
Reviews.Content: This hotel is typical of many of the Marriott hotels I have stayed in. The common areas are in good condition but the rooms and hallways are fairly tired and the dÃ©cor is outdated and needs to be refreshed. Being a gold card holder I was given a free upgrade to the executive floor. The room was a good size and the beds as in all Marriott Hotels was very comfortable and provided a good sleep. The TV did not work but this was fixed. However, the choice of free channels was very poor and one of the worst of any hotel I have stayed in. The hotel has a small pool on one of the upper floors overlooking Sydney. There is also a small but fairly well equipped gym. The executive lounge is simple and lacks ambiance. If you have access they provide a continental breakfast. The restaurant, Windows, has a very good breakfast however at $34 I think it is expensive and over priced. I had room service from Windows and I have to say the food was very good and served quickly after it had been cooked. There are better hotels in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good CBD location, but the property needs an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: MKH-SG
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at this hotel around 1996,and it seems that the rooms haven't changed much! They really need an upgrade from the '60s fittings. That said, the location is very useful - near both CBD and Liverpool st. The staff were friendly and mostly effective in their handling of issues.

Reviews.Title: “Easter weekend in the City”
Reviews.Author: CJSYD
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night on Good Friday and it was a pleasant surprise. We booked online and it was "as described" with a great view of Hyde Park. We had dinner in the restaurant which was very good and breakfast also was great. The staff were pleasant and polite. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good hotel just a little more effort and it could be a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: DoraDementia
Reviews.Content: Nice room with an amazing view of Hyde Park. Hotel is in a great location for walking to all the sites. Around 10-15 mins to the opera house. Typical Marriot hotel room very nice with everything you need including a well stocked mini bar. There's a nice gym and pool on the roof with great views too. Housekeeping were patchy. Knocked the door at 8.30 to clean the room - not great when you checked in late the night before. Also they didn't fill up toiletries and coffee etc each day. I had to phone 3 times one night to get coffee and sugar. The web site says bathrobes are provided but we didn't have any and when I enquired was told they are not in all the rooms. However, the girl said she would bring me one right away....I'm still waiting! Overall a good hotel just a little more effort and it could be a great hotel. We got a good rate, if you get that I would give it a try. If you pay a lot it might be better shopping around

Reviews.Title: “Getting a little worn around the edges”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior30
Reviews.Content: ACCEPTABLE: With a booming economy, SYD hotels have taken advantage by increasing prices and lowering standard This property is well situated on Hyde Park (though it's a walk to the main shopping & business district). Check-in and staff throughout my stays (2 in recent weeks) were accommodating and professional. Hallways are bright and clean, but on closer inspection, peeling wall paper a tale tail sign of age is apparent. Rooms are quite large and nicely equipped with small microwave, kettle, coffee/tea service and assortment of plates. Bedding is comfortable. Desk area is large, with nice lamp, but desk itself was chipped in numerous places. The hotel was quite full for Easter and there was some moderate room to room noise. Internet is charged and had adequate speeds. Rooms facing Hyde Park are afforded a great view of the park. Double paned windows ensure no road noise, but also ensure no fresh air. The bathroom is large, nicely tiled and have a soaker tub (not my thing, but quite common in Australia). Plenty of hot water and pressure. Fixtures as well are a bit dated. Moderate amenities. Now for the negatives: Lighting, the usage of yellow fluorescent lighting along with a strange white wall paint, cast the entire room in a sick glow. The bathrooms brownish tiles along with yellowish light made it seem dark and dirty. The 'net is I stayed twice in short order so while there is nothing terribly serious to NOT warrant your consideration, there are numerous hotels in the area that might be a better value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good sydney hotel”
Reviews.Author: RichardCLT
Reviews.Content: Solid choice. Good beds, rooms, bathrooms; quiet hotel, good location right by airport train and park loved it. Good lounge too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but bad service”
Reviews.Author: missy078
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night with a friend. Room was great - very comfortable bed, lovely views over Hyde Park. Breakfast was very disappointing (especially at that price). The breakfast room was more than half empty, however we had to first ask for our table to be set (since there were no other set tables we could sit at). We then had to ask for our coffee four times before we got it half an hour later (and one of the coffees were not what we ordered). I unfortunately had left my pyjamas in the room. I phoned the next day and they said they would call me back, but didn't. I then dropped in to the hotel a few days later to enquire if housekeeping had found them and I was asked to step aside so they could attend to other customers at the reception desk (even though I was at the front of the line). Room was nice. Pity about the bad service.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING!!!! Worst Staff Awful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Nicolem90
Reviews.Content: What an embarrassment to Sydney. Two friends and I booked a room here for one night. We had a girlfriends henâ€™s night on that night and wanted a place to sleep because we new it would be a big night! Arrived at our room it was nothing like the website. The air conditioner did not work at all. They had someone look at it and thatâ€™s all they did. We asked to be moved to another room, they ignored us. It was like a furnace was on in the room. They eventually said ok we can give you a fan. A small little fan that they probably got from a $2 shop. How is this place a 4.5 star hotel?? The location is ok. Itâ€™s a bit of a walk to Kings Cross and George Street. Very close to Oxford Street if thatâ€™s what you are after. Later on we went out had dinner, got ready and we were out of the hotel by 7pm. Arrived back at the hotel around 3am to find ourselves locked out of our room! Went down to reception to find out what was going on and the rudest receptionist I have ever come across simply said she received complaints that we were making too much noise so they locked us out of our room! Why????? Itâ€™s a bit funny considering we werenâ€™t even in our room making these "supposed" noises when the complaint came through. My friend was at reception for about 30 min trying to get the reception staff to let us back in our room, we didnâ€™t want to stay anymore; we just wanted to get our stuff and leave! Eventually they let us back in. I have nothing positive to say about this dump! The rooms are old fashioned, nothing like there website. If you want to enjoy your holiday or a night out on the town in Sydney DO NOT stay here. You will be left disappointed. There are far better hotels that are cheaper, clean and staff who will bend over backwards for you. This hotel is none of that!

Reviews.Title: “Poor value, outdated”
Reviews.Author: Annexaviera
Reviews.Content: I purchased the "autumn special" deluxe park view room. The only good thing I can say was that the view was good. The room was tiny, the furniture was decades old and showing wear and tear. Evening the hair dryer was old and crappy. The food we ordered to the room was also pretty average - stale bread came with the cheese plate. The gym facilities are decent with nice view. What made this so disappointing was that the "value" of the room was advertised at +$600. Total joke. Even in the hallways I noticed the wallpaper crumbling.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for the Hyde Park end of town”
Reviews.Author: isobellatravels
Reviews.Content: Good location for the Hyde Park end of town. Great cafes nearby off Oxford Street, The roof top pool is very pleasant with awesome views especially in the evening. Quick and efficient check/out. Room service was prompt. Had some issues getting the TV working and they had someone there quickly to fix it. A good business hotel, I had a room on the business lounge level which meant very handy access to a coffee machine. Fabulous huge bathtub. I was a bit put off that the room on business lounge level did not include free internet access though.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, not very good value”
Reviews.Author: fbbToronto
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sydney Marriott for 6 nights in March 2011. I enjoyed my stay at the hotel, however would hesitate to recommend as I donâ€™t feel that their standard rates are reflective of the quality and service you will receive. Rooms: My room was spacious and well maintained. As some previous posters have pointed out, some of the features are outdated â€“ the most outdated in my room was the washroom. It was perfectly functional, just not what you would expect for a hotel asking $400 AUD per night. There was a very small kitchenette as soon as you walked in with two hot plates and a separate sink; a desk, a sofa, and coffee table. The TV was awkwardly placed as the bed and sofa faced each other; the TV was placed to the side. I initially had several problems turning the TV on to the point where I had to call the hotel reception â€“ even the concierge had problems with the TV! Eventually it worked, but it was not very user friendly. For example, you canâ€™t switch channels directly by putting the channel number in (you have to use the up/down arrows). You could tell by a faint smell that the sofa was of a certain age â€“ by no means was the smell unbearable â€“ but the fabric wasnâ€™t the most comfortable. Sleep Quality: The bed was on the firm side. I had a queen size bed with 3 regular size pillows, and 3 oversize pillows â€“ both mattress and pillows were comfortable. Location: Either fantastic or not so great, depending on what you are in Sydney for. I liked the location as it is practically next to the bars on Oxford Street. However, if the main reason youâ€™re in Sydney is for tourist stuff, such as the Harbour and Circular Quay, then there are many other hotels that are closer to those. The Sydney Marriott is about a 30-minute walk to the Harbour. There is a bus to Bondi that leaves from literally around the corner from the hotel. Cleanliness: Very clean. Service: Not the best, but not terrible; definitely neither as good nor as consistent as with the other Marriotts Iâ€™ve stayed at. When I arrived at the hotel via taxi, there was no one to help with my suitcase â€“ no one was around in the lobby except at the front desk. Check-in was fast and courteous, and when I was checked-in the agent offered assistance with my bag (I declined). I asked the concierge for assistance several times during my stay for everything from directions, to taxi bookings, to hotel technical help and found them to be friendly and helpful. Check-out was fast (although it was very early and I was the only one); no assistance with my bag was offered at check-out. Value: Standard rates for the days that I stayed started at over $400 AUD; for significantly less, you could stay at the Shangri-La, which if I remember was slightly less than $200AUD. There are many other hotels in Sydney for less. Conclusion: I had a good stay at the Marriott and would recommend it if your main criteria is location close to Oxford Street; otherwise, the hotel is overpriced and not the most convenient for visiting the tourist attractions in central Sydney. The hotel has renovated and is nice in some areas, however the hotelâ€™s dÃ©cor, service, and amenities are not reflective of the price tag. Compared to other Marriotts (Ottawa, Toronto, Bangkok), where staff almost always appear genuinely happy to see you and offer help with pretty much everything, the Sydney Marriott is nowhere near this level. Compared with hotels in other cities, Iâ€™ve gotten much better service for much less.

Reviews.Title: “Great location average service”
Reviews.Author: ElJohns
Reviews.Content: The location is great, closed to all attraction, cafes and restaurants in Sury Hills. However don't expect much service (common inn Sydney). Rooms are small and boring but still clean. We didn't try the breakfast at the hotel due to better choice at the streets cafes. There are a fitness room and a small swimming pool in the roof. All in all OK place to stay because of location, but I will chose something else next time I'm in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: mr_los_angeles
Reviews.Content: this hotel is well located and the staff is helpful. however, considering the room rates this hotel is a bit "old and tired". there is not much to the fitness center. be advised that if you pay any hotel charges with a credit card they charge and additional 1.5% fee! .....and try not to use the telephone$$$.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing”
Reviews.Author: pmechor
Reviews.Content: My good perception of the Marriott chain disappeared after my stay at this hotel. The staff were neither effective nor welcoming, the cleanliness was poor (old cracker under the TV, used kleenex under the bed) and you just felt like nobody really cared about your stay. A representative example of our experience: I dialed customer service because the rollaway bed we had requested in our reservation was not there. Nobody picked the phone, so after maybe 20 rings I went downstairs to request a bed or cot at the reception desk. A cot was brought up, not opened for us (just left there) and with just a small blanket and no sheets. So I had to go downstairs again to request the sheets. In whole it took about half an hour to have the cot ready. Some more details: We had lunch at the bar on the day we arrived: there was just one waiter and so it took ages to be served and ages to get the bill. The internet connection (not free) was terrible: I could not even get the sign-up page to load. The location is good but the service is just bad. We only went up to the rooftop pool once: it was a cold day and we did not actually try it, but be aware that it is very small.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money”
Reviews.Author: JimmyJames57
Reviews.Content: Just a typical high rise hotel on Hyde Park. Nothing special, for a lot less money I moved to The Grace Hotel on Darling Harbour and actually felt like I wasn't staying at a corporate mega hotel. Used my points for a free night but would never pay the >$300 a night. It was clean, efficient, etc....but for all I know I was in Chicago. Bland, average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel with three star service”
Reviews.Author: benbris
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights for my 30th. Spent the extra money for the occassion. Arrived on Friday night at 7 and checked in straight away. Was really impressed with service until opened door to room. Handbag on bench and suitcase in middle of floor. Mmm. Somebody else's room maybe? Went down to reception and made to wait for 20 mins while each room on the floor was checked. Do their computers not tell them what rooms are vacant? Eventually given a room which was not what we paid for, but by this time completely over it. Location was really good. Housekeeping was good each day. Would definitely not stay here again. Not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: newsomma
Reviews.Content: Here on a business trip for a week - wasn't sure this was a good pick but I have to say I've loved this location and the room has been more than adequate for my needs. Conveniently located to Hyde Park and public transit - I've loved the location. The park makes for a lovely stroll in the evenings. The walk to Circular Quay is a leisurely 30 minutes and the nearest train station is only a 5 minute walk. The room was well equipt and had a huge tub! I recommend for any traveler who wants something nice and reliable and in a good location!

Reviews.Title: “Best In Class Custmer Service”
Reviews.Author: ScubaDavid
Reviews.Content: I would like to recognize the Marriott Sydney (Hyde Park) Australia property. Customer service was world class. Our room was very nicely appointed, great Sydney skyline view and the concierge level lounge had a very relaxing atmosphere with a wide selection of food and beverages. In addition, the pool and fitness center located on the roof has excellent views of the Sydney skyline and of Hyde Park located directly across the street. One of the managers on the property whose name is Michael did an extraordinary job to make our stay one of the most enjoyable vacations in recent years with his extensive knowledge of Sydney and the surrounding areas. Iâ€™ve been in the service industry for over four decades and Michael exemplified an attitude of customers first AND always had a smile I highly recommend staying at this property when visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Nice....compared to the Travelodge....”
Reviews.Author: jameskdean
Reviews.Content: Staff was great, but the place was understaffed requiring you to wait for basic service. Need an electrical adapter? Plan to wait 30+ minutes for it. Breakfast area was cramped and the food wasn't very nice. One of the elevators was down which made going in and out of the hotel an ordeal. It's definitely a tourist hotel. Plan to share the space with school groups and Gray Line tours. Asiana also uses the hotel as a crew hotel, so make sure you're not trying to check out when the tour buses and airline crew leaves. ** Insult to Injury ** Hotel charges you the credit card merchant fee. Instead of just adding to you roomrate like other properties. Good if your sole purpose is to go out and party on Oxford Street. Location cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: rc33
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were excellent. From the check-in to check-out, they were all very friendly and seemed to exceed my expectations. It was the little things that were nice like calling to advise me that my room service was on its way to the chit chat at check-out. The room was large with a small kitchenette and king bed with a sofa bed. It was larger than I thought it would be. The bathroom had a shower over a large corner bath. The room seemed a but tired as the sofa was showing its age but all in all, a pleasant room and had a comfortable bed. The location of the hotel is close to the city centre and next to Hyde Park. Close to Museum Station and only a short walk into the heart of the city. Room service was delivered promptly and tasted fine. I tried their 'breakfast on the go' which you had to pick up from their restaurant. It worked effectively. Overall I was surprised at the quality of the staff and would be happy to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location-We walked the whole city”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug1427
Reviews.Content: The Sydney Marriott is located on Hyde Park. It is about a 15-20 minute walk to the harbour and the Opera House. We visited Sydney in August and the weather was beautiful. The room at Sydney Marriott was quite spacious. I was traveling with a friend. I took the sofa bed and found it to be very comfortable. The hotel is just a couple of blocks away from some fun and funk dining options. It was just one block from the Australian Museum, which is excellent. When I was researching our trip to Sydney I was worried about hotels being too far away from the Opera House area. Having now visited the city I feel confident in saying that it is definitely a walkable city, and Hyde Park is not too far away.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful breakfast but extremely noisy other guests (latter not hotel's fault)”
Reviews.Author: Victorianlad
Reviews.Content: Stayed six nights. Checkin was OK,. My room on the 11th floor had good views of Hyde Park. I paid an average rate of $230 over the Christmas and New Year period.. The standard of room fittings was satisfactory although lighting was mucked up by trendy, ineffective and dull light globes: so much for ridciculous 'environmental efficiency.' The bathroom had a bath and an excellent old type showerhead with towels being sufficient in size and number.. There was free tea and coffee in the room, while the bed was excellent. There should however be two separate chairs not one (two indivdiuals cou;d not have sat at the table.) On two occasions I had the included brekky (full cooked buffet style): best of its style I have ever had! Obnoxious guests alongside and above were screaming, hotel security attended at my request during the day and early evening: above me, children were jumping from the bed in another room onto the floor. The noise stopped by 2300 I have never heard such long showers from others while the plumbing for adjacent rooms was noisy. One nearby room occupant's shower lasted 29 minutes and 14 seconds because I timed it. Overall, a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with a great loacation right by the park!”
Reviews.Author: Kelingyun
Reviews.Content: We had an executive room and really indulged ourselves in the great buffet and drinks. Breakfast was also quite good. Location is great too. You can walk to the bar street, the CBD and even the harbours. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Ok but needs refurbishing”
Reviews.Author: Harry1Melbourne
Reviews.Content: Pleasant enough, but needs a makeover. A little "chipped & cracked". The rooms are a good size with nice views. Mini kitchen is handy, prefer a separate shower to one over the bath. Also bit of a walk to main attractions. But having said all that would stay here again. Staff very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Only average”
Reviews.Author: Clea700
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fine. It's opposite a park and close to Oxford street and Crowne St Surry Hills for restaurants. The hotel however is looking quite tired and a bit rundown. It was a comfortable stay but certainly nothing to rave about. It was fine for our 1 night stay but I wouldn't be keen to stay here for much longer.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Quality Rooms...wouldn't recommend”
Reviews.Author: durantt
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Marriott previous times before in different cities and having had a great experience we decided to opt for them in Sydney for a special weekend trip with our 7 and 3 year old. Its something that I now regret and I wish we had stuck with the Intercontinental where we had a great experience previously. On arrival we asked for a room with a bath for our 2 children, we were told we would have to wait for the room so after waiting in the lobby for a short period for the room to become available we were escorted to the room. On entering the room we found a member of staff on the phone, who informed us that the room door was broken and that maintenance would be sent up to fix it. We waited for around 40minutes for maintenance and wanting to go to the Sydney wildlife park before it closed. When maintenance turned up we waited around for another 20minutes whilst he came back and forth to collect tools to fix the door. We were unable to leave the hotel before this as the door had to be left open. Having fixed the door we then set off, made the wildlife park with an hour to spare and had dinner. Returning to the hotel I started to try and run a bath for the kids only to find that the mixer tap wouldn't work. My husband came to help and he couldn't get the taps to work either. We then tried the shower and ended up drenched when the shower head fell off. So we called reception. We were told that maintenance had left for the night but someone would be sent up. In the next 10minutes a member of staff arrived and for around 30minutes they played with the shower head and went back and forth to repair it. We were told it was fixed but when trying to use it the same thing happened. It took another 2 calls and trying to tell the member of staff that the whole shower hose needed to be replaced to get it working....we never were able to use the bath as the mixer tap still didn't work. By now the kids were over tired and fed up waiting for over an hour, as were we who had spent our evening with staff in and out of the room. These were the 2 main incidents that spoiled our stay, but also in general the room was dated and there were smear marks on the cupboards. When we briefly visited the pool in the morning the cleaner was banging his mop bucket and kept looking in whilst my daughter and I were in the sauna. Finally we complained to the manager on leaving and his response was " I'm sorry to hear that" then we wrote to the hotel to get the same response and after a couple of letters were told "next time we come back they will make it up to us" I can only think that to get that response they must have a lot of complaints...whatever would make them think that we would stay with again when there are far superior hotels in Sydney at the same prices. The only good thing I can say is that the ground staff were very polite and friendly throughout and that the location of the outdoor pool on top floor with views over the city would have been a great spot had we been able to enjoy it more, however for the money spent there, there are far better hotels in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: NYCRegular09
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week on business, which I do 4 times a year in Sydney and usually stay at Circular Quay Marriott. I rarely write negatively, but I will never return to this property. The hotel is clearly dated, but worse is the complete lack of competent service. If youl look at recent reviews, may other people are saying the same thing - the hotel is fine unless you need something. Then it is completely unprofessional. IF YOU ARE COMMITTED MARRIOTT GO TO CIRCULAR QUAY! My situation: Their Internet - critical for overseas travelers is weak and was taken down by a conference they were hosting the same week. I was unable to connect for three days. Internet was pre-paid with my room, so I tried to have the daily Internet rate credited back to my account. I spoke daily with front desk staff and the 'at your service' line and was promised a return call every time. No one ever did. After four days of trying, I finally took someone's name down who promised to call me back with an answer. But a day later nothing, and when I went and found him he said sheepishly my phone was not working in my room and couldn't reach me. This after he accused me originally of never really speaking to anyone yet. Final solution, as I checked out I complained to another person that a pre-paid service was unfulfilled and I wanted my money back. The desk clerk offered to keep my account open and send me a letter when back in the US if they were able to resolve the $25 charge. Five days of trying to get a $25 credit back for a pre-paid service and the answer to is to wait by mail if I have been approved. Plus directions were consistently incorrect - Darling Harbor Ferry Location, restaurant, bus stops. My business partner booked his room with mine, but was charged differently. Couldn't ever resolve. STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Madrid1977
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good located and the staff very friendly, specially in the executive lounge (I can't remember the name of a Philippine waiter but he is fantastic) which is opened all day, very convenient. The rooms are big, comfortable and clean, with microwave, toaster and tea/coffee making facilities. Nice bed and pillows. The bathrooms was very big as well. The pool is not very big and when I visited it there were plenty of kids.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer beware, we did not get what we paid for.”
Reviews.Author: dkiegler
Reviews.Content: Our king size bed sagged so bad, I had an aching back within twenty minutes of trying to go to sleep. The refrigerator was broken and a bathroom faucet was malfunctioning. We moved to what management called â€œthe only other available roomâ€� in order to get a good bed. This second room was considerably smaller than the first, had only a queen size bed, and a weak air conditioner. We ended up getting stuck in this smaller room for four nights. Marriott management refused to give us a price reduction claiming that both rooms are in the same â€œclassâ€�, since they both have a â€œpark viewâ€�. Not an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Average - Service not good, rooms dated.”
Reviews.Author: Rachael1070
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not at all a 5 star. Bath was broken, room was dated. We booked for three people and paid extra and the room was just set up for two. Fold out couch extremely uncomfortable. Room service was TERRIBLE. When make a special request such as no tomato due to allergies they will consistently completely ignore this. Otherwise, some of the staff are extremely friendly! Particularly the room service boy from the UK. The hotel is in a good location also. Can walk to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel; good for families”
Reviews.Author: wowsam
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family including a 4, 6 and a 12 year old. We are not the easiest on hotels. The beds were nice, room was well furnished as you'd expect. The bath was a large soaking tub, and very deep and wide, could fit 2-3 folks. The pool and club are on the top floor. The hot tub is not very hot; but that was a very good thing for us since the kids got in and out and had a blast. The location is right on Hyde Park and behind the hotel you have a number of nice eateries in the neighborhood in Darlinghurst. You can walk from here where ever you want to go but not on the circular quay naturally. This was our second hotel in Sydney and the service was fantastic...one of the bellman went out of his way to catch me an elevator when my hands were full and he was about 50 feet away...very nice. Also used the in/out self-park which was fine as well. All in all we were very happy at the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Property. Expensive Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: I-heart-Travel
Reviews.Content: This property is located at the western edge of Hyde Park. The nearest CityRail station is Museum, but travelers with many or heavy suitcases be forewarned, there is no elevator (lift) or escalator (moving stairs) at this one station - there are numerous steps to climb. (A taxi from Central Station to this property will run about $10 and highly recommended.) The hotel is modern and appears to be recently renovated. My room was very clean, quiet, and comfortable. I had a view of Sydney Harbour even though I hadn't requested a special room, nor was I on a high floor. The hotel is located right close to Liverpool street and there are numerous restaurants within walking distance. Everything from Subway and Hungry Jacks (Burger King) to many finds in Chinatown. My room (and others on this floor) was equipped with a two-burner electric stove -- odd, I think, for a hotel. There were pots and pans provided; oddly there was no dishsoap, nor a fan to vent fumes. I did not elect to cook my own meals, nor could I smell anyone else doing so. The only drawback against this property that I can mention is that I was continually displeased with the quality and pricing of the breakfast service - a Continental was offered for $26 and a full breakfast for only $8 more - yet could I honestly say that the full was worth the extra money. To get anyone to cook eggs or an omelet was a true game of hide and seek. Refills of coffee were never offered - you had to track down one of two waiters on duty that morning. I did not eat at the restaurant for lunch or supper. There is a four-station business centre right off the lobby; I was warned that I needed to purchase one hour's worth of Internet access time yet neither I nor anyone else that used the PCs were ever asked for codes or log-ins. This property is wonderful for all who have business in Sydney or vacationing and do not want to pay the extra funds for staying at the Circular Quay - the CQ station is a three minute subway ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy rooms, great amenities, nice location”
Reviews.Author: tjp131
Reviews.Content: I always stay at this hotel when in Sydney as I usually get a room with cooking facilities and couch / coffee table, so it feels more like home and allows me to cook my own meals. The rooms were getting a little tired looking but they seem to be refurbishing bit by bit. New TV system recently put in isn't the best - remote is slow to respond, doesn't seem to get some of the new digital TV channels like 7TWO, GO, GEM. Very comfy beds (Marriott hotels are renowned for their beds) and good sized bathrooms with spa bath. Windows that open! Very quiet too even with the occasional inconsiderate guest slamming their door during the night. Most of the reception staff are friendly though some aren't - but they do their job adequately enough. Prompt service when I rang 'At your Service' re a TV fault. The gym is good, has enough equipment for the number of people using it when I do (early morning) - with nice views over Hyde Park. Just around the corner from Oxford St (lots of take away places, restaurants, bars etc) and easy walking distance to more central Sydney e.g. Circular Quay is about 20 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “great service and view”
Reviews.Author: Dertje82
Reviews.Content: loved this hotel! great pool on top of the building with great view!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but average customer service”
Reviews.Author: Mas1978
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the city which is great if you're looking to be close to the CBD. The rooms are nice and also well kept. It is what you would expect from a Marriott hotel. The customer service, however, leaves a lot to be desired. The staff in the lobby are helpful but not very friendly. The managers are quite rude and tend to speak to you in a condescending tone. Both I and my friends experienced this. Also, on several occasions over a three day period we dialled '9' for customer service and no-one answered. If you are after a nice hotel with good services then this hotel will suit you. If customer service, however, is important to you then I would probably look else where.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for staying with young children”
Reviews.Author: waterbaby0928
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 3 nights with a 2 and 3.5 year old. When we arrived from Los Angeles, it was about 7:30am. My 2 year old was screaming and crying from the long trip and I didn't expect that we could check in right away, but it never hurts to try! The front desk staff- Elaine in particular- was very accommodating and helpful. She found the first available room, even giving us a complimentary upgrade. They gave us a beautiful room overlooking hyde park with a king bed and sofabed for the kids. It also had an oversized soaking tub, which was great after a long day on your feet. We ordered room service for dinner for the kids everynight because the kids loved the cheese and tomato pizza they offer. I have to say the breakfast in the restaurant was great too because kids under 4 eat free from the buffet (which was awesome) and that's a big help. The location was perfect too because it's right next to the Australia Museum which has a dinosaur exhibit and a kids area for them to play- not mention it's nice to be located across the street from a park when you have kids. For us it was a great location because the train station is right there at the park (although if you have a stroller, you should go to the Townhall station where they have an elevator). It's also only a short walk to Chinatown and Darling Harbour. This hotel is pretty much central to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but somethings to watch out for”
Reviews.Author: Victorjuliet
Reviews.Content: Candid feedback Plus: -Lounge staff - POL is the most friendly guy I have seen so far.. Very hospitable and a great human being. Lee & Harry are also very friendly. -Some reception staff were very helpful and friendly (Elaine & Vivek). -Room is comfortably sized -Very comfortable bed and well spaced bathroom. -Awesome location. Next to Hyde park - one of the most beautiful parks I have seen and just a 5 minute drive to Opera house and all landmarks. -Beautiful pool and Jacuzzi on the rooftop Negatives: -You definitely want to avoid this lady at the reception (wearing black glasses). She needs to be trained on how to talk to Customers. Imagine having stayed in the same hotel for over 4 weeks (Total stay of 7 weeks) and this lady at the reception asks for a ID card when I asked for a subsitute access card coz I had forgotten mine in the room, especially when she has seen me over and over again in those 4 weeks...That was rude!! Definitely not what you expect of a 2 star hotel, let alone a 5 star property -Carpets are very old and definitely needs a big facelift. -Gold card members: Except lounge access, nothing can be expected, like Free Internet or phone calls or laundry. Overall, its a good hotel, but there are definitely better ones.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: colinsong
Reviews.Content: This is definitely the worst Marriott I have stayed. There is no "Marriott-ness" in this hotel at all. There is no porter to help me with my luggage when I arrive the hotel, and also not when I check-out. There no nothing special with this place, and I'd give it a "3-star" at best. And don't expect any form of "service" because I felt that the staff tried their very best not to serve you at all. FOR:- a) Near to Sydney Museum. AGAINST:- a) No service whatsoever b) Room door has THE loudest creak I have ever heard of ANY kind of door, but wasn't maintained/repaired. c) No service d) No service e) No service

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Nice Area of Town”
Reviews.Author: pullthetab
Reviews.Content: Nice standard Marriott hotel (which is a good thing) in a pretty nice area of town, convenient to a lot of restaurants and not too far for shopping (less than 1km). Not as nice as being on the water, but certainly less expensive. Pros: Clean nice rooms. Friendly staff. Safe in rooms Cons: Very expensive restaurant ($40 for breakfast buffet) Bit of a taxi ride to the harbor area ($13-30 depending on time of day each way). Most taxis amazingly had no idea where the hotel was located, even after we provided the street name, and drove around looking for it. Have to say was not impressed with the taxi service overall in Sydney - not very friendly or knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot”
Reviews.Author: AussieTraveler43
Reviews.Content: I stay here for business on a regular basis. The hotel is in a really good spot and is easy to access, plus its close to my work. Staff are always friendly and I'm happy with the service when I stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: kucing
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend. Good location, clean, good size bedrooms, big bathroom with a spa bath, gorgeous view from the windows. Friendly receptionists, comfortable beds, very good blackout curtains (useful, especially when having jetlage), nicely scented toiletries. Hallway carpet a little tired but very clean. The commonal laundry room was under maintenance, so couldn't do our laundry there, which wasn't a problem as it wasn't a week-long stay.

Reviews.Title: “Deprived not Revive”
Reviews.Author: young4life
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 nights through Wotif.com, paid $279 per night for a 'Premier' Room which includes a room on the 8-14th floor (there are no rooms below the 8th floor), 2 ' Revive' queen beds.The pillows and mattress were extremely soft and I had 2 sleepless nights, the air-con didn't seem to be working as the temperature gauge didn't move from 25.5c. The rooms are large, and bathroom is generously sized with a corner bath/shower but as mentioned before the decor needs to be updated - burgundy duvet cover and pillows are not appealing. On our first morning we left our room at 8.30am and returned at 2pm and our room had not been cleaned - this is a pet peeve of mine - 5 hours is surely enough time to get to our room. there's only 15-17 rooms per floor. After a rest in our room we left at 3.15pm, the cleaner was still on our floor attending to another room, we returned at 6.30pm and our room was not cleaned. Our hotel room had a lovely view over Hyde Park and the Hop-on, Hop-off Bus stop,was conveniently only a block away outside the Australian Museum. I highly recommend this tour, lots of fun on the double decker bus. Be careful when booking because the Sydney Bus Authoity has their own hop-on hop-off bus tour, on regular red buses, and a little more exxy from memory. Parking is $25AUD per day, with unlimited entry/exit. Room service is approx. $36AUD for a main meal and $5 service charge. Beakfast buffet is tasty and plentiful and costs $34AUD per adult and $16AUD per child, if not included with your room booking. I would probably not stay here again when i visit Sydney unless i got a room for less than $200, for the price i paid I think I'd stay in Darling Harbour closer to where the action is. Lastly, all the staff we came across from room service, front desk and restaurant were lovely and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive buffets but great location for walking about”
Reviews.Author: MarJan6861
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at the Marriott Harbour Hotel where we stayed for 8 days. Our 31st floor room had a great view of the Opera House and Circular Quay. The room was clean and it had many electrical outlets but another outlet would have been helpful in the bathroom. The in-room internet was slow and expensive at $25 for 24 hours. The concierge was very helpful. The hotelâ€™s location is great for exploring The Rocks, using the Circular Quay ferries, and walking uptown. The room had a small refrigerator into which we were able to put some small containers of milk. The TV was not a flat screen. The room lighting was good. The room was quiet, housekeeping staff were very good, but the furnishings looked slightly tired and average. It had in-room safe but limited drawers for clothing. The window had sliding solid doors which kept the room dark at night. The meals were expensive (figures are Australian dollars): breakfast $35, lunch $40 and dinner a whopping $98.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: David92263
Reviews.Content: It had been a few years since my last trip to Sydney but I had a vague recall of the location of this hotel, although never inside its doors. From first arrival when the valet, Chris, took my bags to the desk, to doing an early check-in the staff were impeccable. Toby on the desk was the epitome of smartness (as were all the staff) friendly and welcoming. Sometimes a request for an early check-in and a booking via a "bid-system" has earned me a room miles from an elevator or a poor view. Toby allocated me an excellent room on the 9th floor overlooking Hyde Park and the famous ANZAC monument. The room was large with a big double bed, TV, kitchen facilities including items I did not use eg microwave and toaster. The bathroom had a triangular bath and overhead shower. I did venture to the roof and sure enough there on the 25th floor was an open air pool - a bit chilly for this Californian. On the occasions I had to use concierge service it was friendly and helpful. The mezzanine bar 36 was good for bar snacks and beers - maybe a little expensive but nice surroundings and friendly staff. The open-top City tour bus has a stop 100 yards from the hotel and some great shopping is on the other side of the park- 10 minutes stroll away. There are fast food outlets and liquor stores on Oxford Street 5 minutes walk from the hotel but the room was comfortable enough that on two evenings I watched TV and had dinner in the room I've had to think hard to find anything wrong with this hotel. Maybe a broader choice of TV channels? I think I found something - the shaving mirror in the bathroom is too far from the sink !! Believe me if that's the worst thing I could find this hotel cannot be that bad.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: julie4444
Reviews.Content: Really lovely hotel, great room, clean, big and comfy. Reception was run well, staff were all friendly and helpful. Great area, very central with city views, opposite Hyde Park which was lovely to wander around. Would def go back when we go back to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Clean with Good Service - Decor a Tad Dated”
Reviews.Author: the2monkeys
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in late October 2009 for 3 nights - we got a great deal as it was a Wotif Mystery Hotel! The room itself was large and clean, although the decor was a tad dated. The air conditioning wasn't working in the room so it was blisteringly hot - our flight got in late and we asked if we could change rooms, but apparently the hotel was full (odd - as it seemed empty!), so they sent someone up to our room at 11.30pm to fix it! Staff generally very friendly and eager to help. Bed was EXTREMELY comfortable! One particular thing we loved about the hotel was the gym, spa pool and swimming pool on the top floor. The gym has good-quality equipment and is well-maintained. The swimming pool is on the roof, and you have the most amazing views relaxing on a lounger next to the pool after a swim. We went for a few twilight laps every evening we were there, and it was wonderfully relaxing. Felt a little bit like being in your own penthouse apartment! Location is excellent - right opposite Hyde Park. Our room was on the 8th or 9th floor (can't quite remember), and there were beautiful views across the park and surrounding buildings. A short and beautiful walk (say, 15 minutes) to the Opera House. The surrounding Haymarket area has some really great restaurants too! In short I would recommend staying here if you can get a good price for it and you want to be in central Sydney - but it's certainly not what I would call a luxury or top-end hotel. More like a high-quality mid-range hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel & Service EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Calista77
Reviews.Content: The Manager's customer service, or lack of service should I say is the most shocking service I have ever experienced! The staff have absolutely no idea on how to communicate with customers or relay mecessary information. Air con was also not working on a freezing cold night and we were offered 1 small heater that could hardly warm up a 1x1m room. No compensation, discounts, apologies, only disgusting behaviour from a obviously immature boy who they have appointed as their manager. Would never stay at this hotel again, even if I was offered a free stay.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Marriott in a great location”
Reviews.Author: colomonica
Reviews.Content: This hotel sits right on Hyde Park in the center of Sydney. Everything is within walking distance. Our room was a little tired by Marriott standards, but very large and comfortable nonetheless. I'm sure we didn't have the best view in the hotel (we faced east) but we could still see the harbor so it was gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit for a whole bindle of cash”
Reviews.Author: sjoconn
Reviews.Content: This is an average hotel with clean rooms and close to public transportation and a very nice view of Hyde Park and the Anzac Memorial. However it cost way more than its worth. Rooms seem way over proced for what they are, internet is $30 per 24 hour period (not 24 hours of use) or $133 per week. Breakfast is $40 for an average breakfast buffet. A standard room is $240 per night. The gym is estremely limited. I know Sydney is expensive......but this is just silly.

Reviews.Title: “The best!”
Reviews.Author: GrizDenver
Reviews.Content: Not sure what other reviewers have talked about. I am a Marriott rewards member and have stayed at several Marriott's across the world and this is one of the best ones. I think it has the best location of any hotel in Sydney. You are right across from the train station and the harbor. The ferry system is about a 5 min walk and the opera house is maybe a 10 min walk. The harbor bridge and the Rocks are about a 15-20 min walk. The lounge is very nice and has all day refreshments and a pretty good desert. The staff is very helpful in making recommendations and reservations and when my wife and I looked a little confused from the directions to the bus station that one of the employees gave us he walked outside with us to the bus station and explained the system to us. It was a perfect stay and again is close to everything. If you are going to do souvenir shopping, go to Paddy's Market. Best deals in town and you can take the free bus there or walk it...it took us about 30 min to walk back with several bags.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Public Transportation but not the Harbor”
Reviews.Author: celusnek
Reviews.Content: We bid $115 for a one-night stay in a five-star hotel in Sydney CBD on Priceline.com. It was the Sydney Marriott that accepted our offer. I figured that Museum was the closest stop on the Air-Link train. Sure enough, The Marriott was easy to find when we surfaced from the underground. The hotel sits on the southeast corner of Hyde Park. We got to the hotel about 9am after the long, long journey from Fort Lauderdale, Florida and I really wanted a shower. At first we were told it would be a few hours until our room was ready. The front-desk staff must have seen the need in my face, because once I explained how long we had been traveling, they went ahead and let us check-in! Room 1101 is large with a little kitchenette, desk, pull-out sofa, and a queen size bed. The bathroom is enormous, but about 15-years out of style! However, it was sure nice to fill up that big bath and soak away the trip. The amenities and towels are average. The bed is comfortable, but we were so tired, itâ€™s hard to really know. Itâ€™s a very pleasant 20-minute to walk to the Harbor. Several buses stop across the park from the hotel. There are a few cafes in the office buildings on Liverpool Street that were handy for breakfast. There are a few internet cafes also. The hotel charges for Wi-Fi, but I think the in-room wire connection is free. We would stay in Sydney for the next several nights and thought we would stay at the Marriott for the same rate, but the hotel wanted close the $300/night. So, we moved on. In summary, the hotel is located near public transportation but not very close to the harbor. The rooms are average. The hotel definitely seems more suited for business travelers. The staff is very accommodating. I recommend it, if you can get it for less than $150.

Reviews.Title: “Plus and minus ...”
Reviews.Author: PrivacyAboveAll
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel quite a bit, and continue to, mainly because of its excellent location for accessibility by car, as you can avoid the worst of Sydney traffic and the downtown area when arriving at or departing from the hotel. Beyond that ... I've always found the staff friendly and helpful, the rooms and bathroom relatively spacious, the beds very comfortable, the view of Hyde Park excellent (assuming your room is on the "right" side), and taxis generally readily available outside the hotel. The in-room safe is large enough to hold a moderately sized laptop computer, which is always appreciated. Having said all that, this establishment does have some work to do in certain areas. The worst offender in my experience is room service. Very rarely have I had a trouble-free order. Time and time again something is omitted from the order or it takes an eternity to arrive. I recently had to call up to cancel the simplest possible breakfast (toast and coffee) when it still hadn't arrived after 30 minutes (in fact, it appeared that the order had actually been lost). Another problem is that I often wait a very long time for the "At your service" number to answer and have to hang up and try it again later (or I get a busy tone when you call it). I wouldn't mention this if it was a rare occurrence but it's happened enough for me to mention it. And having said all that, whenever I have had a problem it's always been resolved expeditiously, and any money cheerfully refunded where appropriate. In summary, the facilities are good, the staff are friendly and helpful, but the service needs attention. RATING: I had to rate it AVERAGE though I would prefer to rate it GOOD (between AVERAGE and VERY GOOD).

Reviews.Title: “Good, but for this price expected more”
Reviews.Author: Hozay_G
Reviews.Content: I travelled with a group of four women to Sydney for the weekend and booked a junior suite at this hotel. All in all, we enjoyed our stay at the Marriott mainly as it served as an excellent base to shop, dine, party and see the sights of Sydney. Oxford St, Surry Hills and the main shopping district were all within walking distance, and the Harbour/Opera House are also close by (20-30 minute walk, 5 minute taxi). The proximity next to the train station also made it very quick and easy to get to/from the airport - however the train tickets were not cheap at around $16 each! The accommodation was very adequate and clean, the bathroom was huge and had a spa, and sitting area spacious enough to relax and entertain in. The service was good - especially from one young man who attempted to go beyond the call of duty by setting up our tv to connect to our music player. In the end it wasn't possible, and there was no way to play any music in the room, but he did give it a try and also came back a few times to see if there was anything else he could do. We really did not intend to spend much time in the room so did not focus too much on what we received. However on reflection, for the expense there were a few things we thought were lacking. For example there were four of us in the room however they continued to supply us with only two sets of things like robes, towels etc. Also we did not seem to have the bins and kitchen cleaned/replaced each day (had to wash our glasses/ cups etc). The roof top pool did have great views but it was really too cold to swim in (despite that it was December!) so we tried the spa which was not working. We also thought it was rather strange that every time any of us contacted reception by phone or in person, they called us by the name of the person who made the booking - clearly it was possible that that wasn't our name? That was more amusing than a bother, however, did feel rather awkward after a while. In summary, the Marriott was pretty good, but has been scored down due to the relative value (cost versus service).

Reviews.Title: “expensive & only just OK”
Reviews.Author: PrinceAyla
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine but the check-out staff were disorganised. If you have a special offer at this hotel make sure you have and keep a copy of it for check out as they denied this was our case even though we booked it over the Marriot 0800 number. We had a copy so just an irritation for us. Pool not worth it and very noisy. Go to Starbucks for breakfast and only far up Oxford street (road) only if you have a broad mind - fine for me but my wife thought it was too seedy. The teenagers loved Oxford St - though and saw a little more about life on the wild side. A good sushi bar down Oxford St.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kupunakane
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the negative reviews, other than perhaps people being lazy (we walked to and from Circular Quay twice in one day) or not keeping documentation of reservations. We found the hotel to be bright and clean, well-staffed wtih very friendly and helpful employees. We loved the location--a pleasant walk to the Quay or Opera House, close to some attractions (Sydney Tower), next to the park, convenient to Chinatown and a cluster of nice Italian restaurants as well as to shopping and Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Mrsgetaway
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during our recent trip to Australia and were delighted that we had chosen to stay there. We had wanted the Marriott at Circular Quay but it was fully booked as it was an extremely busy weekend in Sydney so we settled for the one on Collesge Street and were not disappointed as it was lovely, and within walking distance of all the main tourist areas. The only thing that was missing was the harbour view but as we were out and about most of the time this was not a big issue. Our room on the 18th floor, overlooking Hyde Park, was furnished to a very high standard, and had a large bathroom with corner bath and shower. There is a small swimming pool on the roof which was a godsend to cool off after a long day sight seeing. The hotel was entirely non smoking which was a big plus for us. The only small criticism was the bin in the outside foyer was often overflowing with rubbish as passers by used it as well as hotel guests - not a good look! Apart from this, we were delighted with the hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, welcoming and a pool with views to take your breath away.”
Reviews.Author: MikeyMike247
Reviews.Content: My wife, 19 month old son and I stayed at this hotel as the first stop on our 3 week trip to NSW. The hotel was very clean and the room was more than spacious enough for what we required or even expected, with a great view of the coast (although the building being built right nextdoor did limit the view towards the Opera House). The views from the pool on the roof are simply beautiful and the gym next to it, small but well equipped. A mention must be made for the helpfullness of the staff. One of the wheels from our childs pushchair fell off on the last day of our stay and even though we'd already checked out, gone out for a few hours and then returned to collect our bags, with a broken buggy, the staff went to great effort to help us and the maintenance man took the broken part away and returned 20 minutes later and fixed the broken wheel. The pram is still going strong 4 weeks after this fix. All in all our stay was very pleasant and I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels ever”
Reviews.Author: foo_foo_bunny
Reviews.Content: This hotel is need of renovation. The rooms are tired, the walls are gray and depressing, carpet looks like it expired about 30 years ago. The lighting is from the 70's, which makes the room look even worst. There is no dresser to put away any clothes, there are two closets in the room, but they are so dingy I was reluctant to hang my suites in there. Service is just as tired as the hotel - it took 20 min to get through to order some room service. There are much better hotels around the area in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not up to Marriott standards”
Reviews.Author: Gagga
Reviews.Content: Easy walk from cruise ship for post cruise stay. It's a very busy hotel with a lot of business travelers apparently. Need for more front desk during check in/check out peak times. Needs some sprucing, showing wear with stained carpet in the room, some mold in the shower and missing shower tiles. Not up to usual Marriott standard, especially for price. Good location for restaurants, sightseeing and catching Hop on bus. Not much of a gym, too small, cluttered & old equipment, poorly ventilated.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Place To Stay Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: mmmcb
Reviews.Content: Over looking Hyde Park Sydney, The Sydney Marriott Hotel was an excellent choice for our 4 night stay in Sydney. The upgrade which included access to the executive lounge was excellent value and made our stay even more enjoyable, the executive lounge is a great place to meet and mingle with other guests. We met some fabulous people there. The location is great as it is very central to downtown Sydney and it's just a 10 minute walk to the bridge and the opera house. Staff at the hotel where also very helpful and did everything they could to make sure we enjoyed our stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel very close to Oxford Street and opposite Hyde Park”
Reviews.Author: YanniB
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights in early January. Got a great price as this must be more for Business travellers than leaisure, and it wasn't peak business season. Room was good size with a couch. Bed was extremely comfortable with more pillows than you could poke a stick at. Rooftop pool looked very glamorous with great views but is fairly small so appeared more crowded than what it was. Well equipped gym and nice housekeeping staff. Very close to oxford street if you want to party the night away with gay abandon. I asked (but didn't receive) a room with view of the park but still got a nice view over darlinghurst and the neon lights of Kings Cross in the distance. If you can get it at a good price I'd definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: wetravelin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is off the beaten path. Area did not seem like a real safe area. It IS NOT close to Ciruclar Cay or the opera house area. There are 2 Marriotts in Sydney. Make sure you know which one you are at. The bell captain seemed to go out of his way to try and please. It is no way a 5 star hotel by any stretch of the imagination. This hotel is old. I was amazed when we checked in our room had not been vacuumed, the couch was filthy dirty and there were stains on the decorative pillows, the rug and the 1/4 spread on top of the bed. The towels were thin and they provided one bar of soap so you had to take it from the sink to the tub. Bathroom was large and looked like it had been somewhat remodeled. Air conditioning was at a minimum. The room never really felt cool. There was a pool and hot tub on the top floor however the hot tub was filthy and I would not consider going into either. The view was great . The continental breakfast was pricey but so is all of Australia and dinner was even more pricey. Cant believe they charge for bread! No coffee pot in room just instant coffee with a microwave. This was not like any Marriott I have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, price and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: zoerobinson
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of night in Sydney. Wasn't at the hotel much but found the location perfect for touristy stuff. Buffet breakfast was really good also. Prices were fair though they changed from day to day which was a pain

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable but needs updating!”
Reviews.Author: KTJMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business in January 2010 as I couldn't get into my first choice hotel. My room had a small kitchenette (which was a surprise!) and city views. The bathroom fittings need an update as they are showing their age, although everything was fully functional apart from the lack of pressure in the cold water tap. The hotel is next to Hyde Park, and a few streets away is Stanley Street, which is a definate must go and eat place which some bars and cafes - it has a nice villagey feel. I had room service one night - and the food was OK - although wished I had found Stanley Street earlier! The staff are very nice and accommodating. My main disappointment with the hotel was the the gym - around half of the equipment was faulty - (two of the steppers and one of the exercise bikes) so I had to try the ones I wanted to use and move onto the next piece if it didn't work. The saving grace is that its on the top floor and has great city and park views although the sun can be exceptionally bright!

Reviews.Title: “Poor value”
Reviews.Author: kate040
Reviews.Content: Overall a low 3 star stay for 4 star price. The location is great, but the value for the Marriott was poor. We stayed 6 days between Christmas and New Years, and found it higher than expected and the rooms just okay. The pool is poorly maintained with no chaise lounges and no shade, the internet is expensive and confusing, the windows so dirty that you can barely see the park across the street and there is construction next door on a high rise.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad .....”
Reviews.Author: Andy_L680
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days as the Marriott at Circular Quay (where I usually stay) was full. This hotel has many good points and is let down by a few things which probably show gaps in management. The receptionists were friendly but there was often only one person on duty which means that a queue could build up. One less porter and one more receptionist could be a better balance. Room was good with the usual comfortable Marriott bed. Thereâ€™s a modern flat screen television and coffee making facilities together with a small fridge in which you could store your own items as well as being the mini-bar. Plenty of wardrobe and drawer space. The room is let down by the aging bathroom. The bath is an odd shape and doubles as the shower which could do with a little more â€œpowerâ€�. There is a good gym, jacuzzi and pool on the roof level â€“ the pool is wonderful to cool down after a day out in the heat of the city. What did let the hotel down considerably was the Executive Lounge. When it worked it was excellent and it clearly has great potential but was let down on a number of counts: * Staff could not keep up with clearing tables and replenishing stocks at breakfast making it difficult to find somewhere clean to sit and then finding any food once you had found a seat. The management were clearly aware of the problem but had not allocated anyone else to be on duty * The layout of lounge was inadequate for evening use â€“ I am convinced the lounge is probably big enough but the available space is used badly * No free WiFi and only one Internet terminal * Few chairs had a view of the tv * No newspapers In summary I think the extra cost of the Marriott Circular Quay is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Odd Room + Fantastic Location = Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: TandemWorld
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly situated on incredible Hyde Park - within reasonable walking distance to nearly everything. However, other factors led to a mixed experience. Most noteworthy... LOCATION - Get a room on the Park side, and you could sit and stare at it ceaselessly. It really is remarkable. QUALITY - This is where things get a bit odd. When you walk in, it is clear that they've done quite an update. This makes getting to your room a bit of a shock. You walk in and see the wonderful bed you'd expect from a Marriott and then you look over and see a couch that's very old (in reasonable shape, yes, but old). These kinds of contradictions exist throughout the hotel. VIEW - Get up to the roof to enjoy the view and the pool (although small). SERVICE - Nice service at check in but inconsistent the rest of the time. Called for something from room service that never arrived. Room seemed well cleaned one day and rushed through the next. ADD-ONS - Prices for extras - like Internet - were insane. Check it out before you book, as this can quickly add up.

Reviews.Title: “a bit OCD on security”
Reviews.Author: kylzandmarty
Reviews.Content: my partner and I stayed here for two nights. We had problems checking in as I don't have a driever license despite my partner offering hers and her credit card. We were then told they didn't have any king size rooms available as per our booking. The location was great and the view from our room was lovely but I would not stay here again on the basis of service.
