We had problems with our bath and did not find the amenities to be standard for a 5 star hotel. On dpearture we also had a fire alarm test 30 mins before check out time - it was just all a bit over the top.

Reviews.Title: “Average 3.5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: love2travelTokyo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with my fiance. Managed to get pretty cheap rates on the net, so wasn't going to complain too much. But without those cheap rates, definitely would not stay here. Positives - Gym was open 24 hours and there is quite a nice view from the rooftop pool - Views are decent (but obscured by dirty windows) - Reception service was actually quite good Negatives - Rooms were outdated and felt old, dusty and dirty - Windows were very dirty so view was obscured - Hallways smelt badly - Location is not great - far away from shopping, circular quay...but close to darlinghurst but visitors are unlikely to eat in that area Definitely not a 5 star and would barely scrape as a 4 star hotel...but if you manage to get a cheap discount rate, then it is worth considering if you don't want to pay-up for 5 stars like hilton, intercontinental etc.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Marriott Excellent for Executive Travelers”
Reviews.Author: Z06_Driver
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at the Marriott. Enjoyed the executive lounge. Good breakfasts, surprisingly generous dinner snacks, and free wine. Rooms are fine, as is the internet connection. Enjoyed waking-up with the view of the park every morning. Walked to my client's place daily. Plan to stay another 2 weeks early in 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice rooms but smelly elevator”
Reviews.Author: x_globetrotter
Reviews.Content: The Marriot is located in front of Hyde Park which is a great location to get to the CBD, you're already in it, use the city skytram, the bus service departs in front of Hyde Park so if you want to head to the beach in Bondi or Bronte you can just get your tickets at the 7 eleven and hop on the bus. You're 30 seconds away from Liverpool St and the World Sqaure Sopping Centre where you can get awesome sushi at Sushi Roll, great Thai Food at Thai Express and real Italian Coffee at Lavazza on the corner. From this point on you head to George St which is filled with shops and bars 24/7. If you want to head directly to Darling Harbour or The Rocks just use the skytram. The Hotel itself was really nice and I loved the bed with all the pillows! All Sydney accomodation is a bit overrrated so I guess the Marriot would already be one of the cheaper ones. A neagative would definitely be the smelly elevator. It smelled really fishy like some water had been leaking for ages and a lot of people were bothered by it.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms very outdated and Hyde Park view spoiled by the dirty windows”
Reviews.Author: windred
Reviews.Content: For a 5 star Hotel this is definitely not 5 star , whilst the foyer is nice and the service friendly the rooms are very tired and outdated looking like something out of the 1980's The location is great but we were disappointed that the view of Hyde Park was destroyed by windows which looked like they hadn't been cleaned for months. The rooms were comfortable but well below what we expected

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with old furnishings and bathroom”
Reviews.Author: intttraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel thinking it would be a great 5 star - but it came well short of being a 5 star. It is very close to restaurants and we had great view of the Hyde Park. That was the best part! The hotel has old furnishings and the bathroom shower and tub is definitely outdated. We booked through priceline so we did get a decent price - but it was no where close to a 5 star. I would rate it as an upscale 3.5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to Hyde Park”
Reviews.Author: liamuk2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during November 2009 for one night. It's a perfectly reasonable hotel and can be had for a bargain price on some travel sites. Not quite up to the standard of other Marriott's I've stayed in but fine for a short stay. It's not right in the heart of the touristy things to do but it's only a short walk to the train station (2 stops to Circular Quay) or across the park to the downtown area. If it's your first time in Sydney then the other Marriott at Circular Quay might be better with ferries right by the hotel. Views are of either the park or looking towards Kings Cross. If you have the choice I'd definitely try to get a room with a park view. Would stay here again as long as it's a competitive rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for GLBT Travelers”
Reviews.Author: Albiani
Reviews.Content: This is one of two Marriott's in downtown Sydney. If travelling w/ a family I would suggest staying at the Sydney Harbour Marriott, but if you are single, a couple looking for nightlife or Gay this is the better location. First, it is very central and easily accessible to Darling Harbour, Opera House & Circular Quay (pronounced "Key"). The rooms are a bit dated but I found that to be the case in many properties in Sydney. Whatever the rooms lacked was more than made up for by the fantastic view we had (request a high room w/ a view of Hyde Park) this side of the hotel has a lovely view of the downtown park below and much of the city's skyline. If you have Gold Elite Status w/ Marriott you can take advantage of their members lounge on the top floor. They provide a full breakfast in the morning and plenty of food and drink in the evening which can be very helpful when you consider how expensive eating in Sydney can be. I figured we saved about $20 each morning and $40 each evening that we ate in the members lounge vs. going out to dinner. In addition, you can access 24/7 the PC they have for guests. I has an internet connection, which I found very helpful for checking up on my e-mail while away. If you are a Gay / Lesbian traveler I think you will be very pleased with the hotel's one block walk to Oxford Street (the 'gay district'). It certainly made going out easier and more fun esp. if you are out very late. While this is not the nicest Marriott I've ever stayed in (that distinction belongs to the Marriott Bangkok), it is centrally located, the rooms are a good size (as is the bathroom) and everyone there was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: JK949
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a deal on Priceline.. Having won a bid for week in Sydney for $79/night on the cusp of the high season was a great find. Location - Centrally located in the CBD. Close to public transit to get you to Bondi, West Sydney, Circular Quay, Airport, etc. The hotel is somewhat adjacent to the Museum stop on the subway (less than 5 minute walk along Hyde Park). We found the location to be convenient as everything was within 10-15 mintues in every direction. Hotel - Decent. The public spaces were fine. Lobby seemed refreshed as did the pool area and gym. The gym was on the top floor with great Hyde Park views, though the A/C didn't seem to work so it made for stuffy workouts. The pool was small, but relatively clean, but could have been a bit warmer. The executive lounge on the 21st floor was a deal! For only $60AUD more per night, our party of 3 had a warm breakfast every day along with evening appetizers and open bar. This saved us a lot of money as food is generally expensive in Sydney especially with the weak US dollar. The entry to the lounge also affords one free internet on the one computer, which was enough for our stay and beat the $20+ the hotel wanted for daily room access. Also, 24 hour access to water and non-alcoholic drinks was a great plus. The food was decent and changed slightly during the evenings, but the same for breakfast. Evening appetizers ranged from a cheese plate, canapes, fruit, chicken strips, oysters on the half shell, shrimp skewers, and even a lite turkey dinner on Thanksgiving for us US folks. Rooms - Decent. These are standard hotel rooms. Being on the 21st floor, we had sweeping views of Hyde Park and the Sydney Tower. Bathroom was large, though only one sink. The tub was very large and a bit awkward, but fit the bill. I wish the room was slightly larger so that there was more seating area. The room was equipped with a mini kitchen (refrigerator and microwave), which helped with keeping juices, snacks and water handy. Cons - Slow elevators and a stench from a broken sewer pipe in the car park beneath the hotel. It took 2 days to remedy, yet the front desk seemed to pass it off as though it was okay. Also, immediately outside the hotel, there is not much to do or see. You will have to get yourself a few blocks in any direction to find some food, though it is close to Chinatown for some inexpensive and yummy eats. I would stay here again, but only at the great rate received through Priceline. With the added executive lounge (acquired at check-in), the nightly rate was under $150US, which is much less than the quoted $289AUD (standard room, no lounge) that Marriott offered directly.

Reviews.Title: “Getting a bit dowdy”
Reviews.Author: Jack_3B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right in the old business district, probably a bit too close to some of the seedier tourist neighborhoods (Kings Cross and the Oxford St. gay area) for some tourists. The public areas have undergone refurbishing, but the rooms have a "70's gone to seed" look, ancient scratched furniture, dark purple fabrics, etc. There are maintenance issues all around - for example, two of four elliptical machines at the gym were broken. The executive lounge was presided over by a cute young boy on one night, then by a surly woman the next (she was nearly an hour late setting up drinks, with no explanation as the guests milled about), then by an awkward fellow on the third night. Despite the changing cast, the menu was exactly the same each night. Better to spend a bit more money and stay at the Harbour Marriott, with a fresher decor and much more attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing great”
Reviews.Author: AmFl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days in Nov. Thought it was over-priced for what it was. Had trouble with the internet not working in our room ($29 a day for internet). We were in a corner room and there is construction on the building next door, so it was extremely noisy. For the things we did it probably would have been better to have stayed in a different location - perhaps Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, decent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LoveThoseStamps
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located to the Museum stop on the rail line which is quite convenient to get to/from the airport and is a relatively short walk to the Town Hall stop which will get you to a wider range of locations. It's also right across the street from the Anzac Memorial which is nice to look at in the evenings when it's lit up but it quite a ways from the harbor areas. We spent a lot of our days down in the harbor areas so the location was not as convenient for us though you can always hop on the train and be there in less than 15 minutes. I was a little disappointed with the cleanliness of the room. I felt really hesitant to sit on the couch as there was visible dirt and it was quite worn though the housekeeping staff did a nice job of maintaining what was in their control. The bed was a little soft for my taste though it was comfortable enough to get a good sleep without any aches and pains. I did appreciate the large bath tub and kitchenette equipped with everything you might need to whip up a quick meal or snack. The in-room heating cooling systems were never the right temperature. We tried adjusting it constantly and also mentioned it to the front desk but nothing changed during our stay. The temperature in the gym was also quite warm so I ended up taking my workout outside which turned out to be cooler. The pool area was nice but the jacuzzi area smelled too strongly of chemicals for me to use it in the confined indoor space. Fees for internet/printer use are quite expensive so I recommend considering other options if you stay here. Bottom line: The hotel was fine for the deal we got but I would not be willing to pay regular price for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarlSlough
Reviews.Content: Second time i have stayed at this hotel and each time i have not had any problems. It's a 2 min walk to the nearest rail station and bus stops. The staff were very helpful and when inquired about getting around to places they would print off timetables for buses and trains. As for the rooms they were large and included microwaves, plates, knifes and forks. If i go back to sydney i will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: nikki27
Reviews.Content: What can I say? Superb hotel. We were upgraded to a city facing room which was lovely on the 17th floor. Quick & simple check-in with the friendly receptionist who informed us of where everything was in the area & explained how to get to all the attractions. Room was excellent ~ spotless & very spacious. Bath was huge, more like a small swimming pool! About 15 mins walk to the Opera House (via the Botanical Gardens) I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location - one of my favourites”
Reviews.Author: Banjokazoie
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel 3 or 4 times previously, and have always really enjoyed my stay. This time was for over 3 weeks. The staff are attentive and friendly, but never intrusive. In particular the regular waiters at breakfast (I wish I could remember their names) made each morning a pleasure. Rooms are well appointed, and the gym and spa area on the roof are lovely, with great views over the city. All in all, my favourite hotel in my favourite city in the world! A bit pricey, but you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: tropicalsunshine87
Reviews.Content: From the minute I checked in to departure, I was thoroughly pleased with the services of the Sydney Marriott Hotel. Located around the corner from Oxford Street, and easy to get to other areas of the city - I found it to be the perfect location. I arrived at 7am, after an early morning flight and had booked the hotel on last minute hotel deals, and was not expecting to be checked in until at least 11am - however, reception greeted me and after a speedy check-in they gave me a room card and I was in my room in less than fifteen minutes! Perfect! The room was top quality - enormous and very comfortable beds, quality linen and space to relax - it was missing a balcony, but the rooftop pool more than made up for that! I enjoyed drinks, relaxation and a stunning view by this rooftop pool with friends. On our last morning, we ordered room service breakfast - it did take awhile - 40minutes, however, the menu stated that if they took longer than half an hour, room service was on them. We pointed out that breakfast took 40 minutes and housekeeping were more than happy to accept that the bill was on them. Excellent stay - I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: smurflady1
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel was a good price (via Priceline) and had a kitchenette, which saved us some money on meals. Room was clean and service was prompt. The only complaints are really expensive internet ($30 per night) and the location, which wasn't too convenient for visiting Sydney's attractions (Darling Harbour or Circular Quay would have been better places to stay).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mr_meursault
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott for 3 days. The Location is acceptable. Hyde park is a great location, but this hotel in on the corner of the park that is away from everything, so it will add another 5-7 minute walk in comparison to the Sheraton across the park. However, the hotel itself is great. The pool on the roof is amazing, as are the picture windows. The staff is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: SamandDerek
Reviews.Content: Easy check-in. We arrived super early (0830) and was told to check back in about 3 hours. We checked back after 2 hours and went up to our room. We got the room through Priceline and were really impressed. They put us on the 9th floor with an amazing view of Hyde Park. The staff was very friendly, offering restaurant advice, directions, etc. The room was clean and very large with a massive bathroom (that needed a little updating but was not dirty or in disrepair). We used the laundry facilities in the parking garage with ease. We even rented a car and parked for one night and were not charged a parking fee. The hotel is your standard Marriott but it's nice to have some familiarity in a strange city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: bcleverd
Reviews.Content: Located directly across from Hyde Park. Great location and close to underground/trains. You could ride train from airport, but if you have large suitcases the stairs in/out of the stations could be a challenge for some. We took a bus that stopped at several hotels for a good price. We bought our tickets at the airport to hotel and returning for airport. Refrigerator/bar in room. We got a special 5 day stay rate on their website. Very reasonalble for location. Hotel staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “shocking service at breakfast”
Reviews.Author: fsba20
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location, check in was fine and the room nice with a great view over the park. breakfast was a total let down. The service was so so bad. There were staff milling around but clearly no one was in charge or directing what was going on. We were showed to a table not yet re set after the previous occupants, this took several trips for cutlery and linen etc to sort this out. Coffee and tea not forthcoming despite people standing around and we had to ask again, this was once we managed to get the waiters attention - he was too busy showing a text to his friend (another waiter). No plates were out on the buffet/self serve area so we had to ask. My husband ordered an omlette and we thought they were waiting for the hen to lay the eggs it took so long. Meanwhile, a manager was interviewing for staff at a table in the restaurant whilst all the guests were trying in vain to get fed. I complained to the receptionist on my way out as i was so fed up as it was not a cheap hotel and it was not acceptable. we got an apology and later a bottle of wine was sent up to us.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sharonza
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay here and had a great view of Hyde park. Would definatley stay here again

Reviews.Title: “good location-not as good quality as other marriotts”
Reviews.Author: adomurph
Reviews.Content: we stayed here on our sydney leg of our round world honeymoon the location is excellent -only a short walk from st mary's cathedral and a nice stroll to the main amenities of this lovely city. the hotel is clean and bright but the room while spotlessly clean is dated in it's decor. the buffet breakfast was great and plenty of choice. really the rooms not being as opulent as you would expect for a marriott would be my only complaint. staff were friendly and the desk staff particularly were very helpful with directions/airport shuttle info etc!

Reviews.Title: “Great location near Oxford Street (The Strip)”
Reviews.Author: twogaijins
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I stayed here for a week in early June 2009 and had a blast! We had a room with a view over Hyde Park and of the Central Business District which was a really nice view. The room was very clean, quiet, and had two double beds. The bathroom was large and had a corner bath with a shower over it. We didn't use the bath but we commented that it might be fun for couples. There was a fridge in the room (which was so useful for keeping our drinks cool), along with the usual kettle and hairdryer. There was also a microwave, and a supermarket around the corner on Oxford Street where they sell ready meals. There was no free internet but it wasn't prohibitively expensive... it also operated on a 24-hour basis (rather than 'per day') and so this meant that we could be clever about when we signed on to stretch the 24-hours over two days. The hotel is right around the corner from Oxford Street which was great for us! But it wasn't too far in a cab down to the rocks where we had dinner a couple of times, and is a short walk through Hyde Park to the main shopping area. Also useful is that the open-top tour bus passes right in front of the hotel! There is a hotel bus from the hotel but between the 3 of us a taxi proved cheaper and more convenient. The only negative we noticed was that there were supposed to be complementary newspapers by the lifts on our floor but no matter what time we left or came back to the hotel there were never any available. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: nanhey
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel... the best part was the little kitchenette in the room which saved us a LOT of money & was sooooooooooooo convenient! Amazing Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Underrated!”
Reviews.Author: Travel159549
Reviews.Content: We stayed two different times for two nights (the first time with a boring city view, the second time with a park/city view which was much better). We defaulted to this Marriott after an unfortunate experience with a nearby hotel (the other hotel was more for "backpackers" and we didn't realize it!). This Marriott, while certainly not the nicest in the Marriott chains, was a steal at AUD145/night. On the down side, the shower water pressure was poor and the rooms are a bit dated (the shower curtain was fraying and our computer desk chair looks like it has been in service for twenty years. Our window (overlooking Hyde Park) appeared to not have been cleaned in quite some time. The most ridiculous aspect of this hotel is the lobby internet access (AUD8.50 for 30 minutes!). Clearly they are discouraging usage, which is unfortunate as leisure travellers often need quick access. The "fitness center" had no free weights and essentially consisted of cardio equipment. On the plus side, the price was excellent, the room was fairly large and clean, the bathtub was large (the bathroom appeared to have been remodeled), there was no outside noise, the basement had self service laundry for AUD4/wash and AUD4/dry, and the front desk was very helpful with transportation and other items that we asked about. The hotel also had an open-air pool on the roof with nice views in the evening. Given the pricing and essentially standard Marriott service, I would recommend this hotel for a Sydney stay. I think the current TripAdvisor rating severly underrates this hotel. Sure, it's not the Sheraton on the Park, but it seems to be better than several options that are currently ranked higher!

Reviews.Title: “At Best Average”
Reviews.Author: tsogl
Reviews.Content: The Sydney Marriott is shabby and average. We had a room with a park view that was large. This hotel is below average in terms of service. Internet access was expensive and quite uneven. During our 3 night stay, we were not able to get anyone at the hotel to give us a restaurant recommendation beyond "walk down X street and you will find restaurants." The poor service and shabby rooms make this a poor choice that is well below the level one would expect from a Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “A Flawless Weekend Had By All!”
Reviews.Author: SwayAway
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott on College st in Sydney for 2 nights with 3 other girlfriends on a discounted stay (through a holiday website) and we are without doubt returning next year! Service was above and beyond. Room facilities were quality & the view amazing. The hotel facilities were of high quality also, with near new gym equipment & decor. The staff extremely friendly & helpful. The location perfect - right on the gorgeous Hyde Park and a 10min stroll from QVB/shopping centres. The food (restaurant, we didn't order room service) was great & mini bar items surprisingly reasonable in price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property with Good Location; Needs Customer Service Orientation”
Reviews.Author: AroundTheWorldInADay
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to checking into this property, given its location overlooking Hyde Park. Upon arrival, the bell staff members quickly gathered my luggage and were friendly. The great first impression given by the bell staff did not extend to the three ladies working the front desk. I attempted to check-in prior to the "regular" check-in time, and was told to come back in about two hours so I left to explore the city for a couple hours. Upon return, I was told that were still no rooms available but I could have a seat in the lounge and they would let me know when a room became available. Meanwhile, I noticed the staff providing rooms to others without any comment. When I approached the desk to inquire as to how much longer it would be for my room (as the lobby was empty), I was told possibly another 30 minutes. After mentioning that I preferred the other Marriott since it offered its arrivals lounge when I arrived in the morning from an overseas flight, the woman at the desk then mentioned that I could freshen up in their gym facilities. Had she made this available to me when I initially inquired about checking in early due to flying all night, etc., it would have been great! In addition, there was an issue with housekeeping in which I had stayed in my room until early afternoon. Due to this, I requested my room to be cleaned while I was out (I called and mentioned that I was leaving then), and no one ever cleaned the room that day. When I returned to the room, I just wanted to sleep so I dealt with it the next morning. Some of the staff members are fantastic -- bell staff and the duty manager from Finland, for example. Others are mediocre and fail to provide decent customer service, never mind anticipating guest needs. The internet was 29AUD per day max (I think you could also purchase it for .55AUD per minute if you just needed a couple minutes). I wished the hotel had a wireless connection in my room, but I was able to deal with the wired connection. I used the computer for Skype calls so I don't know how much telephone calls were from the room. Now let's talk about what I liked about my stay. My room overlooked Hyde Park. I paid a premium for this, but it was well worth it. The location was convenient to all kinds of nice cafes, restaurants, grocery/convenience stores and even US chains like Starbuck's (diagonally across the park from the hotel), Subway (left out of the hotel and left at the corner onto Oxford St, Subway is about a block up on the right on Oxford St), etc. The location is also great for visiting the Australian Museum (museum offered free admission on Sundays). I could walk to Sydney Harbor, Chinatown, etc. My room was clean and I did not hear any noise from neighbors. The kitchenette setup (microwave, toaster, teapot, mini-bar fridge) was nice for having breakfast and snacks in my room. The hotel is also within a block or so of the Museum train stop, which is handy for anyone wanting to take the train to the hotel from SYD. The hotel is also a stop for the Airport Connection bus, which costs 12AUD each way (allow about an hour to get to the airport from the hotel). Although there were some staff missteps along the way, I would recommend the hotel for a decent place to stay near Hyde Park. Aside from the ladies at the front desk, staff members were friendly and the hotel was clean (except for the day that they didn't clean my room). Having stayed at both Marriotts in Sydney, I would say the Marriott Sydney Harbour is more customer service oriented and a more polished property. Its location is also better for someone visiting Sydney for the first time due to its proximity to the Harbour. Since I had been to Sydney before, the Sydney Marriott offered a chance to explore neighborhoods like Surry Hills and relax in Hyde Park. It was also a smaller, quieter place than the Marriott Sydney Harbour. The best Marriott choice in Sydney will depend on what your needs are...

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: yfb
Reviews.Content: I used priceline for this hotel so I wasn't expecting much. I received a slightly less desirable room facing away from the park but room was still more than acceptable. I found the hotel room to be large and well appointed. The room had a kitchenette, large LCD tv, and good sized work desk. The washroom was fantastic; it featured a large corner tub that would easily accommodate 2 people. I had limited contact with the front desk staff but they seamed friendly and efficient. There was a little problem with the room cleaning the first day but it was all smooth after that. The hotel is slightly outside the business district but there is plenty of shopping and restaurants nearby on Oxford St. The hotel is also close to several transit routes. My major complaint was the charge for the phone and Internet service but that seams to be standard in Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: blondietraveller
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. My boyfriend and I stayed here for 8 nights and absolutely loved it. We had a large room with a huge tub and shower. Everything was very very clean. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The concierge, in particular, was always willing to help us find a rugby game to go to or a place for dinner. The gym was upstairs and free for all guests and there was a pool and sauna. It was very nice on the top floor of the hotel. In addition, the breakfast at the hotel was wonderful! I would highly recommend getting it with your room rate. There were pancakes, cereal, eggs, bacon, and a large assortment of bread and jams, as well as fruit. The hotel was right across from Hyde Park, which was beautiful. In addition, it was right around the corner from a bus stop that took us to bondi beach in about 20 minutes. In addition, Chinatown was very close to the hotel and had a lot of good fairly inexpensive restaurants. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Vesna-Trevor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Sydney, next to Hyde Park, for three nights at the start of our Australia visit and then again for two nights just before leaving. We didn't pick the Marriott so much as it picked us. We booked online through Priceline.com and used the "Name Your Own Price" feature. The Marriott accepted our bid. The room was one of the smaller ones they have, simple in appointments, but very comfortable. We are not ones to spend a lot of time in our room when we travel so, while perhaps small, the room was more than adequate. Check-in and -out was handled very efficiently on both occasions and the people at the desk were courteous and helpful (directions, recommendations for restaurants, etc.). Although a couple of items from the mini bar were mistakenly added to our bill, the clerk at the front desk removed these charges without issue when I explained to them that we had not taken any items. The location was within walking distance for us to many locations such as Circular Quay, Darling Harbour and the CBD. The pool, hottub and exercise room on the roof was fun and well kept. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant. We got a very good deal on the room rate, but I think we would still recommend this hotel even at its regular rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Rate”
Reviews.Author: Lovecraft
Reviews.Content: This Marriot is an old property, but it's well maintained. Room was comfortable, bathroom had a large tub with a shower. Some of the furniture had signs of being old and could be replaced. We were on a 12th floor room, the view to Hyde Park would have been awesome if the windows were clean (I heard that window cleaning in Sydney it's very expensive), but the rest of the room was very clean. Swimming pool is outside in the top floor, but it was to cold to try it. The weakest point was breakfast, while the food was not inedible, it was not great. I think it's better to avoid breakfast in the hotel and have it anywhere else. All in all not a bad hotel, but If I'm ever back to Sydney I'll probably try something else.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the experience”
Reviews.Author: BugsIndia
Reviews.Content: Its one of teh best hotels I have stayed. The view over hyde park is stunning. From the window one could see far accross from our floor. The hospitality was just awesome. The staff is very friendly and warm. We were given a room on the 13th floor, however my wife being superstitous, the floor was changed immediately. The locations is also wonderful. It is right next to the museum and just ten mins away from Sydney harbour and the Opera House. I will recommend anybody going to Sydney to definitely stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Good Price”
Reviews.Author: 101bm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my partner & 2 young children for 2 nights. The room was quite spacious and the view over Hyde Park and the CBD was fantastic. The location is great - right on the edge of Oxford St, across the road from Hyde Park and Museum rail station, close to the restaurants of East Sydney. The buffet breakfast was the usual fare but a bit expensive at $32. The beds were very comfortable and the staff quite affable. I would gladly recommend this hotel and will most likely stay here again. A lot of Americans stay at this hotel so be prepared to find out exactly what they think about everything that is on their mind.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite up to the average major city Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous-Atlanta
Reviews.Content: If you are looking forward to a typical major city Marriott this one will be just a bit below expectations (I expect a reasonable amount from a Marriott), and probably the major issues I have both stem from the computer side. The room for the four of us was actually relatively large and comfortable. The lobby is quite reasonable, but nothing great. The location is great, being right next to Hyde Park and there are plenty of places to eat nearby, as is the subway. On the downside, it took about 20 minutes standing in line to check in (this was the crowd coming from the airport from the US flights that land in the morning), and it appears as though the reason is that the system just does not operate that fast to check folks in quickly. In-room internet access was incredibly expensive, and if I recall, they did not have wireless. They did not have a nice little booth to print out boarding passes, though the folks at the front desk would gladly do that for you. I will add, the staff were quite helpful and friendly. Thus, I would recommend considering this hotel as it has a number of pluses, and the minuses are minor. If the price is right, go for it. Just don't expect a top-flight Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Good for both the tourist and the business traveller”
Reviews.Author: Bulgarian_travels
Reviews.Content: I wanted a relatively cheaper hotel for our stay in Sydney and at 120USD per night, the Sydney Marriott hotel fitted just right. I am a Marriott Gold member and was upgraded to a Park view room (overlooking Hyde Park) and provided access to the Executive Lounge on the 21st floor. We took advantage of the evening cocktail hour (between 5:30 - 7:30pm) almost every night we spent at the hotel and the choices of canapes, snacks and desserts were very good and enough to ruin anyone's dinner. Drink choice is good as well. Breakfast is also served in the lounge between 6:30 - 10:30am, but I never tried it. Otherwise lounge access is 24 hour, should you need to use it at any other time. We arrived two hours before check-in time, and we had to wait about 30 min for our upgraded room to be cleaned, but this was really our choice, as there were other rooms available immediately. Front desk staff were always prompt and courteous, did not come accross any other personnel at the hotel. The rooms are the hotel's weakest side - they are fairly new, but somewhat dull, bathroom - too; since this is a matter of personal preference, you can check out mine or other people's pics, it should give you a pretty good idea to make your own judgement. There is also a little kitchennete area (something like 2m x 1m) with a sink and a few utensils in case you need to use one. Internet is paid (30 AUD! per day) which is another negative for me, considering how many hotels offer this free of charge. Only the hotel lobby and lounge offer wireless internet (at the same price), rooms have LAN access only. The hotel location is excellent and one of its pluses. Its about 20 min walking distance from the Sydney Opera House and Sydney Harbour and about a 15 min walk down to Darling Harbour. The hotel overlooks a very nice (but relatively small) park - Hyde Park, but right next to it is the Sydney Botanical Garden, which is just lovely and stretches all the way to the Opera. The hotel is also close to Chinatown (much smaller and cleaner than NYC's Chinatown) and is pretty much in the middle of Sydney's Business District. The closest stop of Sydney's Train Network is 'Museum' stop, which is in the Northwest corner of Hydepark and the train which stops there can take you anywhere - very well organized punlic transportation system. Transport from the airport can vary from train (about 16AUD per person), 12-14AUD per person (takes about 30min-1hr) and taxi - 30/40AUD (30-45min). My 4 star review should not be considered negative, there was nothing dissappointing about this hotel, rather there isnt much to praise either. Very good choice for visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Kiffs68
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days whilst visiting Sydney. The Hotel is ideally located righ next to Hyde Park making walking to all the main Sydney attractions easy, there is also a tube and main bus line very close if your tired/unable to walk far. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are spacious, with lovely king sized beds. The view (if your at the front) is excellent and worth asking for as you look out over the park and across the CBD. The price was good as we had a buy 3 nights get one free deal, without it it rates along side many other hotels in the area, but none of them were offering such a good deal. The service was good at the bar and the bar/longe area was nicely decorated (we didn't eat here so can't comment).

Reviews.Title: “V Good hotel, good location, great rooms, some minor service issues.”
Reviews.Author: pommie01
Reviews.Content: Got this place on needitnow for around $AUS200 as a mystery hotel - that's good value. There is no doubt that this is a very good hotel. The location is good (well if you are a tourist or are working in the sydney cbd). The rooms are really very good, luxuriously fitted out and very well maintained. Great pillows ! Beds very comfy, but of the "2 twins pushed together to make a king" kind, which isn't my preference of course. Bathroom - all good - no complaints - good size, and well apppointed - separate bath and shower. TV was modern, with a good variety of channels. Had an excellent view of the rear side of the Opera House. I had some issues with service here: - The "on door knob" breakfast ordering didn't work. I put my order on my door well before the deadline of 1am, but the order was not collected. So, no breakfast arrived, and I had to order a-la-carte which was expensive, and inconvenient as I had planned my morning and work calls around the arrival of breakfast at a certain time. - I found the check-in and checkout staff a little terse, grumpy and unfriendly. But I guess we all of a bad day !

Reviews.Title: “excellent location; well-maintained hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelguydc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March 09 for five days on leisure. Didn't know what to expect since a lot of tourbooks and websites don't even list this hotel. Was pleasantly surprised. Room was well-maintained (and clean), decent sized, furnished well but not super-luxuriously (with basic minibar); bathroom was spacious and had decent generic toiletries (not name brand -- fine by me). my room looked out the front on hyde park, which was great, but it appeared that the views out the back of the building, over the hills of darlinghurst and toward the water, were just as good or better. pool and exercise facilities on top floor were good. service was very helpful - e.g., provided adapter within minutes, helped me arrange to print a document when the business center printer was down. i didn't try restaurant. location was superb -- as best i could tell, maybe the best of any hotel in Sydney. walk out the front door and you're right in the heart of Sydney's CBD and all the sights, walk around the back and you're in the middle of residential darlinghurst and a few blocks from paddington, with all the great unique shops and restaurants and nightlife that actual sydney residents patronize. was really glad to be staying on hyde park rather than in the tourist ghettos up by The Rocks or over in Darling Harbour -- and yet those were just a few minutes walk from the marriott for sight-seeing. so, over all, i'd say this is a fine hotel with no shortcomings (that I saw) -- well-maintained, nothing stained or chipped. but it's not a super-luxury property (e.g., it appears that the first five floors of the building are offices). I'd recommend it highly to anyone going to Sydney. Note for gay visitors: Marriott appeared to be the upper-end hotel located closest to Oxford Street, the heart of gay Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but hotel needs some work”
Reviews.Author: bran1957
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Australia and didn't know where to stay but we took a chance on the Marriott Sydney on College street. The location is ideal as it is within a 15 minute walking distance from downtown, chinatown, Sydney opera house and a few minutes farther for Darling Harbor. The hotel is directly adjacent to Hyde park which is a very nice park to stroll or sit on a park bench. We felt safe at all hours walking through the park as it is well lit and well traveled by many locals and tourist. The Marriott rooms were in fair condition but really appears to need a upgrade in carpeting and some appearance items. The carperting in our room was this dark green colored that looked very dirty all the time. The room smelled of some musty odor throughout. My wife screamed one night when she saw a huge roach crawling up the drapes. They have a very nice workout center on the top floor with all the latest equipment, jaccuzzi and pool with a nice lookout area overlooking the city. They have coin operated self service laundry machines but cost are equivalent to $3.00 USD which is quite steep for a load of wash or dry. There is only one restaurant which is located on the 1st floor called WIndows of the world which serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. The hotel tries to upsell the daily breakfast buffet for another $30.00 per day but the buffet is not worth the price and offers not many selections. You would be better off paying for the breakfast when you chose to dine in. There are an abundance of restaurants and food courts in the city and you will have a very difficult time just choosing one place to eat everyday. The Marriott staff was always very helpful and courteous which always make the stay a pleasant experience. Overall, the price we paid for this hotel was good compared with the location and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems, A Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Son_of_a_Sailor_51
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel Feb 28-Mar 05/2009, and had a great time. The hotel is situated near the bus and train lines, and most of the major CBD attractions are within a leisurely stroll. The Staff was more than accomodating, and the room we had was spacious, with great ammenities such as a small refrigerator, microwave, and cutlery and dishes. We appreciated this touch, as we could have breakfast in the morning, as well as stocking up on cold refreshments. (note: the refrigerator is actually a mini-bar, but call the front desk and they will remove the items) The roof top pool is small, but we managed to make us of it, and the view is really nice, so it was all good. Oxford Street is right around the corner, and there is lots of shopping, bars and restaurants. If you walk out the front door of the hotel and turn left, go about two blocks and turn right, then down the hill, there are several more really nice restaurants, hotel pubs etc. I can't remember the name of that street, but just ask at the front desk. All in all,a great area to hang out while in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hoogie74
Reviews.Content: Although not located in the harbor district, the hotel is centrally located and within walking distance to many major attractions and some great restaurants. Our room was beautifully decorated, had modern amenities, was exceptionally clean and large in comparion with other hotels we stayed at while on vacation. We really loved the large spa inspired bathroom. The staff was extremely friendly and courteous. We'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “It truly felt like a Home Away from Home.”
Reviews.Author: paulkiddoc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel quite a bit, and often stay in Marriotts. This was our third trip to Sydney, but our first time staying at the Sydney Marriott Hotel. It was a great experience! Our room had a lovely view, overlooking Hyde Park. It was a short bus ride to almost everywhere, although we mostly walked our way around the lovely city. One route took us through the Botanical Gardens to the Opera House (without stopping, about a 20 minute walk). The room was comfortable, and had the equivalent of a kitchenette - microwave, refrigerator, hot water pot - so we could make breakfast in the room. They even have a coin-operated laundry facility! There was a grocery store around the corner, and a number of internet cafes close at hand, helping us keep our costs in line. As for the staff, they were extremely helpful and friendly. The head concierge, Justin, was fantastic! He helped us on numerous occasions, with a big smile and a big heart. We felt sad leaving him behind. I whole-heartedly recommend Justin and his hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Confusing and a bit Frustrating”
Reviews.Author: milescheifetz
Reviews.Content: When I checked in and went to my room, it had a shocking view of slums and suburban life. When I booked the hotel, I expected to have views of Hyde Park. The room was dark and scary; it looked like a room that had an hourly charge. Went down to reception immediately, and they said I had to pay more to get the Park views. Bar was good, barman was exceptionally cheerful. Room service was bad. Rung them for an ice bucket, and they told me that this tiny plastic box was it. Cleaner stole some of my items. A lot of hassle for the hotel, but it financially settled things. After the outcome I would probably still stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: ChrisWG75
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel through a Priceline bid and feel i really lucked out. Its got a great location for tourists (across from the park and right at the top of Oxford street) so there are lots of dining, entertainment, and transportation options within 5-10 min walk. The room itsself was large, with a full window facing over east Sydney and views of the harbour. It has a kitchen with dishes, microwave, stove top, and fridge so meals could be preparred there. The bathroom was updated and had an oversized tub. The rooftop pool/spa/gym were also clean and updated and had great views of the city as well. The only downside (and this is small) is that the TV was placed against the wall so it was hard to see it from one side of the bed. Not a big problem at all though

Reviews.Title: “Not my usual Marriott stay”
Reviews.Author: 1969usmc1988
Reviews.Content: We alwys try to stay at Marriott when we travel. This time I was not as rewarded as much for doing so. The room was nice but there were some problems. The TV did not work as everything had been unplugged. The Internet connecting was brokend and needed to be replaced. Also the young lady at the restaurant made it sound as if breakfast was included in the room but it was not. The meal was good but not worth the price. The staff was responsive to my different concerns but could not fix all. Overall the establishment was not what I am used to for having the Marriott name attached to it. Next time I will try the Marriott down closer to the Sydney waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome hotel”
Reviews.Author: RENA010
Reviews.Content: Service is tops, the staff were very friendly upon check in and out. Room service was fast and great. The room we stayed in was clean, it was a delux king room but it was large, not like most hotels you stay in that can be rather small. It had a flat screen tv, mirrors on the cupboards on the right side of the bed. There was a large couch and coffee table. Loved the bath tub its large and great to have abubble bath with a glass of wine....one thing thats great about this hotel is the rooftop heated pool and gym which opens 24hours! The rooftop pool was really nice with trendy outdoor furniture and soft lighting. Theres also a heated spa inside next to the gym. Great location as 2mins away from oxford street plenty clubs, restaurants and shops. Also bottle shop just on the corner!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, few small issues”
Reviews.Author: raederle
Reviews.Content: I booked the Sydney Marriott for a week long stay over New Years Eve with my husband and 11 year old, and paid extra to have a top floor room with a park view as a bit of a treat. This booking gave us great views and access to the Executive Lounge where we were provided with a good buffet breakfast, and pre-dinner drinks and nibbles. I chose the Marriott on the basis of the quiet location and the fact that other Marriott hotels I've stayed at have always had good comfortable beds. The Sydney Marriott did not disappoint on either factor. Located across from Hyde Park, the hotel is away from the noise of the central CBD but with the Museum train station located on the other side of the Park and the monorail only a couple of blocks away it was really easy to access all of the main tourist attractions. The Australia Museum is literally down the road, outside which there is a bus-stop to catch one of Sydney's Explorer "Hop on, Hop off" buses. In addition there is an IGA mini-market around the corner on Oxford Street within a couple of minutes walk of the hotel. Our room (2113) was clean, the beds comfortable and the friendly staff did their best to respond to queries and requests promptly. The room had a microwave, crockery, cutlery, a sink and an overstocked minibar fridge (there was no room for any of our own food or drink until we removed some of the contents of the fridge). Although I'd booked for three people the room only had crockery for two but a call to reception rectified this. The room had its own air-conditioning control and the in-room safe was very convenient. However, a couple of other small things did detract from what should have been an excellent experience at the Sydney Marriott. On the day we arrived we were only supplied with two towels. When I asked for an extra towel, as I had booked for three people, I was told that they had run out of towels. We were not supplied with an extra towel for another 24 hours. Given we were paying top dollar for being in Sydney over New Year's, I expected better organisation that this. The guest laundry, located downstairs opposite the carpark, also proved to be less than great. Trying to wash out a couple of beach towels after swimming, my spouse had difficulty with two of the washing machines not working properly and when he finally got a machine to work it took one and a half hours for the wash to complete on the short cycle! Then the first dryer he tried also didn't work. It's really frustrating wasting time like this when you're on holiday. It's definitely time for the hotel to upgrade its laundry. While the breakfast in the Executive Lounge was very nice, the same could not be said for either the room service food nor the hotel's restaurant. A room service pizza was cold and soggy as were my daughter's fish and chips at the restaurant. I ordered a vegetarian lentil curry in the restaurant that said it came with naan bread. When the curry arrived it was tasteless and was supplied with a small hard toasted bread like a pizza base. When I queried the waiter about this not being naan bread he said he would check with the chef. He came back stating that the bakery had sent the wrong order and the chef admitted it wasn't naan bread. But there was no apology nor any offer to reduce the cost of the main course which was quite expensive. I'd definitely stay at the Sydney Marriott again because of the comfort of the room and the location; just won't be eating in the restaurant or doing any laundry there.

Reviews.Title: “Recently renovated Marriott”
Reviews.Author: amann27
Reviews.Content: Pros: + Good location - across from Hyde Park; close proximity to sites but not in a tourist area; close to public transportation + Clean, recently renovated room Cons: - Inexperienced staff (but tried to be helpful) - Limited dining options nearby (except Oxford Street)

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located hotel with excellent views”
Reviews.Author: Huuhkaja
Reviews.Content: We pretty much enjoyed our stay at Sydney Marriott before our flight back to home. This hotel was comfortable and gave us a nice stay for last day of our stay in Australia. We got upgraded to Premium room, higher floor room with view to the Hyde Park. Pros: + Centrally located at Hyde Park. + Good connections: easy to get taxi/ travel by local traffic: Museum Station near by. + Comfortable room with large bathroom. + Excellent amenities. + Great staff at reception. + OK breakfast, many options but not that good as we expected at Marriott. + Partially renovated room. + Pool area at roof top. + Enough comfortable king size bed. Cons: - Partially renovated room, small kitchenette shows its age a bit, but it was not worn down. Also bath tub and tiles were not refurbished but they were very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay”
Reviews.Author: vwp
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel. We stayed here a couple of years ago. Nice large room and bathroom. Great view of Hyde Park (though the windows could use a wash). It is close to the buses and subway and the not-to-miss Australia Museum. Lots of places to eat around the corner. There is a coin laundry, though 3 of the 4 dryers were broken. We had a light blow out and they fixed that right away. If someone is visiting you, there is actually streetside parking to be found behind the hotel. We got in early and stayed a few hours late - no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: CSquaredC2
Reviews.Content: I ended up risking a try with Priceline for the Sydney CBD and ended up getting this hotel for $65 US a night plus taxes. Based on what I paid, the location, and the friendliness, this was a great place. First, it's in a great location across from Hyde Park, around the corner from Oxford Street and about a 10 minute walk to Darling Harbour. I also had no problem getting to The Rocks, Sydney Opera House, The bridge and the Ferry Terminals - I think it was about a 20 minute walk. However, you have access to all the buses on Oxford that will take to The Rocks and even the Bondi Beach buses. I didn't end up using any of the trains so I couldn't comment on how convenient those are. As far as service goes, everyone at the front desk, especially the concierge were helpful. I went solo and had a vague idea of the things I wanted to do so I relied heavily on the concierge to help solidify plans. The hotel room is on the smaller side - but not any different than many hotels in major cities. It was modern and the bed was comfortable and if you ask for a high floor, the view is great. It had a small refrigerator, stove top, microwave and dishes that makes eating in or packing lunches convenient. They also have a laundry room in the hotel for $5 AU a load - each for the washer and dryer. The only real negative I has was the cost of the wireless access - 55 cents/minute up to a max of $27 for every 24 hours. But in doing my research, that is not uncommon in Australia. There are some cafes that have access (most charge - like $2-3/hour), but some do not. It seems like most McDonalds had free access. There is also an IGA Supermarket about a 5 minute walk away on Oxford. As well as a Post, and if you brave Oxford Street at night, there are a ton of eateries open late right around the corner. But Darling Harbour is also close enough for a late night dinner. There are also a couple of great eateries down on the corner of Stanley and Crown Streets. One cafe, I can't recall the name, serves great sandwiches for under $5. There are a few sushi places and a bar as well. I would definitely stay here again. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: Helrick
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the start and end of our trip. The customer service was excellent, especially from porters, receptionist and concierge. They extended our checkout time without any prompting to fit to our flight times. We stayed in a deluxe room first time (view of the opera house) and it was what I would expect of five star. We stayed in a standard room at the end of our trip and though it was smaller, how long do you actually spend in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: PJ26Sydney
Reviews.Content: I booked accomodation in Sydney to stay after a work christmas party, last year we stayed at Rydges World Square and had a terrible experience so I was extra cautious with booking and asking questions etc. We booked a package for $209 which included breakfast and vallet parking which was good value for the season compared to others I looked at. After booking I received an email which stated i could go online and request certain things (smoking, extra towles etc) which we did. We requested a balcony room for smoking and was told we could have that for $15 extra which I went forward and requested by email. I confirmed by phone that they had my request and it was all OK. A day later I received a reply to the email I sent saying they had no balcony rooms available. As I had already confirmed by phone the day before I phoned again to try clarify any confusion. A lady by the name of Melody advised me that the person I had spoke to the day earlier had mistakenly put the booking for a "Park View" room which has no balcony which i was not pleased about so she offered me a "Junior Suite" upgrade for $50 extra bringing the booking to $259 which I agreed to as a higher level, seperate bedroom and spa sounded worth it. As I mentioned earlier due to a previous bad experience at a different hotel I was extra cautious so I phoned again the following day just to make sure everything that was confirmed the day before was on record. The first person I spoke to had no record of it but then transferred me back to Melody who again confirmed it all and assured me when I checked in they would have all the information. When checking in my fears were confirmed and i was told they had only my original booking and they had no Junior Suites available. Melody had not passed on the information. Now this long winded story would seem to be a terrible experience again and potentially it could have been but the staff and manager on duty Jaacks I think his name was were extremely helpful and gave us the balcony room and package I originally booked for $150. Once that was all sorted everthing was just perfect for our stay. The King size bed was incredibly comfortable, the bathroom was nice with a large corner bath. the terrace balcony was huge could probably fit 20 people out there. All the staff went out of their way to ask if we needed help with luggage no matter where in the hotel we were. Vallet parking was excellent very quick with hardly any wait. Much faster than other hotels I have stayed. Breakfast was wonderful on level 1 the room has a beautiful outlook over Hyde Park and everything in the buffet hot and kept stocked up. This Hotel turned a possible terrible experience into an absolutely outstanding experience. Other establishments could learn plenty about Customer Service from the Marriott Sydney. Well Done and Thank You!!

Reviews.Title: “Most likely, never again”
Reviews.Author: DanielDP
Reviews.Content: The hotel didn't impress me at all. We arrived slightly early and they said they didn't have rooms available yet, while lots of people were checking out and some where checking in... The location is not great, but for business that didn't matter. The room was what impressed me the least. Old, small, not usual Marriott quality, especially for the price I was paying!

Reviews.Title: “Beautful Bed & Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: Em101
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the 9th level with my partner for 3 nights. We had an early flight and was allowed to check-in early which was a nice welcome. The room was a bit of a mixture of styles - new bed, tv, tv stand but old style bathroom and kitchen area. The view over Hyde Park made the extra money worth it and there was little noise from the street below. The bed was devine, new tv, spacious but dated bathroom, staff friendly, convenient location, clean and practical gym, pool and sauna (although a constant flow of drunk people up there) with a brilliant view. Room service food was pretty ordinary but some things on menu may be better. The price we paid for this was very reasonable and will most likely return.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott central and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: BillNoonan
Reviews.Content: Our stay in the Marriott during August 2008 was really excellent and the staff were super-friendly. Excellent dining and bar facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: luv2lol
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on wotif for a long weekend away with my partner. I wasn't expecting much from it but was overly impressed by the room. It was extremely clean and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was spacious with an enormous bathtub, not a spa but still relaxing The only downfall was the size of the TV, a big flat screen would have been better in the room. We didn't have a park view room but our view was still excellent, you could see the wharf at woolamooloo and the lights were amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, reliable hotel, with some noise issues”
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in August 2008, in a room booked through Wotif with breakfast included. I was looking for a reliable, pleasant and hassle-free hotel, which was what we (mostly) got. On the upside: - Very helpful, friendly staff - We arrived at 11am and were able to check into our room early, which was very much appreciated - Breakfast was great - Room was clean, pleasantly furnished etc - Room contained a microwave, a toaster and some crockery - we didn't use this, but I can imagine it would be very handy if you were staying for several days Some negatives: - Not good soundproofing - we could hear people quite clearly from the hallway, doors banging etc - Curtain didn't cover the window all the way, so the morning light came in. This combined with the soundproofing meant that we were wide awake by 8am after a late night - not ideal - Hotel is clearly a little old. Not at all shabby, just not all modern and "designer" The location suited us very well - right next to a park, and close to Crown St where we had dinner with friends. We walked from the hotel all the way to the Rocks (about half an hour) and back again with no problems, but if you are not a big walker, you might prefer a hotel closer to the main tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother with the executive lounge”
Reviews.Author: chester60
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through wotif.com.au for my husbands birthday. We chose the executive room with access to the executive lounge. The rooms are clean and beds comfortable. Great location. Don't bother to book the executive lounge rooms, below are the problems. . I booked the executive level room and we were placed in room 1706 not on the top 2 floors as stated in the booking. When we checked in we were given no information about the executive lounge and had to look it up in the hotel directory. We then had to wait 30 minutes for our luggage to be delivered to our room. I had to ring to find out where our luggage was. We also received no evening turndown on either night nor were there any bathrobes in the room. These are all listed items on the hotel website. The wesite also states that there is a cooktop and pans in the executive room which was not there. During our stay the top level was closed for renovations so no spa, pool etc access. This should be stated on the website. The hotel also states that cocktails are available in the executive lounge. This was not the case as there was only one staff member and nowhere set up to have a cocktail made. There was also no cutlery set up for the evening canapes or breakfast. When we arrived for breakfast at 9am there was a very limited selection left and we were told that was all that was available. As breakfast was until 10am the plates should have been replenished with enough selection until 10am when breakfast finished. This is an executive lounge in a 5 star hotel and the service was not good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelinLeather
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked this hotel for our very first trip to Sydney (and first time to Australia too). We stayed in this hotel for 18 nights. I was very pleased with the location of the hotel in the city. We were able to walk all over the city and it seemed very nicely located to all major attractions. However, if you wanted to take the bus there were many lines that stopped only a block away from the hotel. Hotel: The hotel was great and it felt a little better than the typical Marriotts here in the US. This definitely had a smaller hotel feel and that worked to our advantage. We had all the amenities of a chain hotel without feeling lost in an hotel that was so huge we felt ignored. Because we were staying so many nights and booked through marriott's website, the cold buffet breakfast in the restaurant was included. You could upgrade each day to include the hot items if you wished. It was an average cold buffet but I'm not a big morning eater so it was perfect for me to start the day. They also offered a discount on hotel services for those staying an extended period. The room was very nice and there was some chipped paint near the bottom of one wall but I didn't expect perfection. The bathroom was huge and the shower was odd only in that it was so large (triangle shaped). The beds were VERY comfortable and the central air conditioning worked very well. The staff were all very professional and very helpful. When checking in (seeing that we were there for so long) they informed us that if we wanted to have complete use of the mini bar fridge they would be happy to remove all or some of the inventory (without charge) so we could use it to keep our items (soda, water, etc) which worked out great. Housekeeping did a great job every day and we were very pleased with the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and it certainly made our first visit perfect. They have a small workout room, indoor jacuzzi and outdoor pool on the roof that overlooked Hyde park. It was amazing. Location/Bars/Restaurants: This hotel is right at the end of Hyde park at Oxford Street. There are PLENTY of great restaurants on Oxford that you can walk to and it's the place were the (mostly gay) clubs and nightlife was over the weekend. Getting a cab around there was next to impossible late at night because it was SO CROWDED. We were thankful we could walk back from the bars on Oxford. There must have been 20 or so great restaurants along oxford st (Indian, Thai, fast food, etc) and the ones we tried were excellent. Many of them were BYOB so keep that in mind if you are visiting hunter valley or the wine areas and staying at the hotel awhile. Pick up some bottles and enjoy them over dinner!! The real downside was the Internet charges at the hotel. My friend and I wanted to blog our daily adventures for our friends and family to read back in the US. I'm used to paying $10 at an avg hotel in the US to maybe $30-40 at a Four Seasons but this was $90/night but you could buy a week of internet for $150 if I remember correctly. I would verify those rates with the hotel. They might not be completely accurate but they are in the range of what I paid. We paid it anyway...as it wasn't going to stop us from sharing our adventures with eager friends and family back home who would be checking. However, I want to point out that I did check at several other hotels in Sydney and either they didn't have internet at all or they charged about the same rate or more. I think the price will shock anyone from the US but they were in line with local rates.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - a standard Marriott experience”
Reviews.Author: jhaberzetle
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop on our honeymoon - we stayed at the Sydney Marriott on Hyde Park for 4 nights in May 2008. We booked the room through Priceline so the price was quite reasonable by Sydney standards. We mentioned it was our honeymoon on check-in and they gave us a room on one of the upper floors overlooking Hyde Park. The location was nice and central for exploring Sydney - we walked from there to the botanic gardens, the opera house, circular quay, Paddington market, etc. The hotel was clean and nice. The furnishings in our room were somewhat dated but looked fine. Staff was very friendly. We didn't spend too much time in the hotel but enjoyed it when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “As expected”
Reviews.Author: Milonotovaltine
Reviews.Content: I was gonna rate this hotel excellent except for this one thing that bothers me. The bed linens and towels did not smell pleasant, but smelled like sweat, or washed without detergent or dried insufficiently. I expect this class of hotel to provide linens and towels that smell beautiful. I was also disappointed that there were no bathrobe and slippers. In addition, the internet was so slow even though it was supposedly high speed. The best thing is probably the Hyde park view, followed by its spacious space, large bathtub, location and general layout. I guess its a good hotel for honeymooners. Whether to book this hotel again I am not too sure as I am particular about bed linens and towels' odor, but will surely recommend this hotel to others who are not so fussy about this detail.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott by Hyde Park is a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: horizonguys
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott on College Street for 4 nights and found it to be a top class hotel. The staff were very obliging. The room was kept spotless. The location was brilliant. It was 10 minutes walk from Darling Harbour, 15 mins from the Opera House and 30 seconds from Oxford Street which had buses to Bondi Beach. The views of Hyde Park from the bedroom with the Sydney skyline in the background were sublime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations if you're more than 2 people”
Reviews.Author: FlyJayClass
Reviews.Content: To this day I remain mystified as to why when travelling outside of North America it is so difficult to find a hotel room that sleeps more than 2 adults aka has 2 double or queen beds in one room. As we were three, we searched high and low to find such accomodations while in Sydney and finally we came across this property. The only one that could guarantee a room with 2 double beds, not single. What do people DO when travelling as a family or a group of friends in these places? Anyway, the room was clean, modern and very spacious, more than comfortable for 3 adults. Very central, walking distance to almost anywhere in downtown Sydney. The only complaint I do have is that to access the internet from your laptop in the room they want to charge you $30AUD!!! A bit of a rip if you ask me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, central hotel”
Reviews.Author: freakyholiday
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, clean rooms and lobby. Our room was a large room that overlooked the park. Nice touches with the flat screen tv, in room microwave, toaster, plates, etc. We got to check in around 11:30 AM which was nice. The hotel staff were very helpful. The only problem was that you can hear everything going on in the halls, every door shutting, everyone's conversation, etc. from the room. Also, we didn't know before we checked in that the rooftop jacuzzi and pool would not be working. Overall, a good hotel in the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: NetMaestro
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a total of 4 days recently, in two stays of 2 nights each as we left for Blue Mountains in between. I got a real good deal on corporate rates. Booked online and had flexibility to choose all sorts of options including high/low floors, check-in time. As I flew in long-haul and arrived very early in the morning (7am), I asked for early check-in, and was pleasantly surprised that they had the room ready at that time for no additional charge. Room was more than adequate. Nice kichenette, large bath tub, comfortable beds were key features for me. Access to train station is good, at about 5 mins walk (Museum station) which allows easy access to airport. Will consider coming back here for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott was great”
Reviews.Author: helenWellingtonNz
Reviews.Content: We turned up at the marriott on a Friday night without a booking after discovering the hotel we booked had allocated us a room next to a noisy lift shaft. The marriott staff found us a very comfortable room with views of Hyde Park at a reasonable rate. They were extremely helpful, courteous and helped with maps and transport plans for the following two days. A paper was sent to our room each day. The beds were the most comfortable I have slept in and the bathroom had a very large bath.We found the service and friendliness of the staff a lovely welcome to Sydney and I will definitely stay at one of their Hotels again.

Reviews.Title: “A Priceline Gem”
Reviews.Author: Calee_Dubya
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got this hotel on Priceline.com for $125 USD/night (essentially 1/2 off the price you'll find on the Marriott site) and it did not disappoint! Features we enjoyed - Nice large room - Comfortable beds - Amazing view of downtown and Hyde Park - Great location, only about a 10 minute walk to the Opera House - Great service - The staff at the front desk were great! They were both helpful in providing us directions in the city they also offered us a umbrella just in case of rain which was a nice touch. My wife also loved the large triangular tub. It was a bit too shallow for my liking but she's still raving about it and we've been home for a month already. Dislikes - None Would I return? - Definitely... and most importantly I might even pay the full price. Yeah, it was that good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel, Pure Luxury and You Pay for it!”
Reviews.Author: Lifetraveler1
Reviews.Content: Came to Sydney, Australia for a little holiday. Someplace that I have always wanted to go. The first night was spent at the Aaron's Hotel in the Hayward Market area. A very basic hotel, but nice clean and cheap at about $89. The 2nd and 3rd nights were spent at the Sydney Marriott Hotel. Let me be clear, because I was confused at first. There are two Marriotts in Sydney. The Sydney Harbor Marriott Hotel is the most expensive and located within a 5 minute walk from Sydney's popular harbor area. I stayed in the Sydney Marriott Hotel, which is about a 15 minute walk from the other one. It is facing Hyde Park on College St, (I think) and is located in the CBD (Central Business District). The hotel room rates when I checked online were about $200 per night, but honestly, I used 'frequent sleeper' points that I had gathered up over the years. Experience: I was upgraded to an executive type suite (nice) and loved the room. It was very large with lcd type television, the furnishings looked new and modern. The large jacuzzi type tub was great, because I was still recovering from a 14 flight almost 24 hours earlier. The staff was courteous, knew my name immediately and quite helpful in pointing out points of interest. It was a great place to stay for business folks. Now you want to know if I would have paid the $200+ per night for it? Based on the initial price alone on the web, NO! However, now that I've been there, YES, I'd pay for it next time. Sorry, I didn't take any pictures of it. However, I did for the Aaron Hotel review. I'd recommend it for business travelers because of its location and amenities and folks with a couple of kids because of its location across from that really nice Hyde Park. Oh yes, I found a Thai (I usually don't like Thai food) restaurant two blocks away. The food was fantastic. I think it was called 'Thai Princess'. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Hop round the corner”
Reviews.Author: GerryWellingtonNZ
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Hotel College Street Sydney was right up to expectations. The staff are particularly customer aware and friendly. The hotel is well situated to the central CDB and the stroll across Hyde Park each morning and evening was very pleasant . Just a little gtrizzle- the In Room internet charge is too expensive. AUD$29.00 per 24/7. Don't connect- hop round the corner to the Vodafone internet cafe. Very clean and well set out. $2.00 for 30mins. All I needed for checking email etc. Some nice restuarants nearby, Oxford Street has many, but the street is dirty and though I did not feel unsafe, it seems to be the gathering place for the gay and lesbian people and the homeless. The Museum Station ( underground rail) is on opposite corner of Hyde Park and ideal for taking the Airport train to Sydney Airport. $14.00 one way. Would recommend Marriott for visitors wanting centrally located accomodation and adjacent facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay at the Marriott again.”
Reviews.Author: Swansforever
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott on Saturday night the 29th March, 2008. We arrived early to check in which was quick and easy and our luggage was stored. The staff were very friendly and helpful. There was no wait at any stage for the lifts. The room was very large with a sofa, desk, bed and cooking facilities such as hot plates and sink. Basic dishes and utensils were provided. The TV was old but worked well and had pay TV as well as free to air stations. The room was a little worn (or not brand new) but was spotlessly clean and very comfortable. I had four guests over to visit for a couple of hours and there was plenty of room. The bathroom is very large - lots of bench space, a large spa bath and plenty of towels. Toiletries are good quality. We did not have a room overlooking Hyde Park but as it was a corner room we could see the park from the side window.
