Our main view was to the Eastern suburbs and you could see a bit of the harbour as well. It was a very pleasant view. The room was extremely quiet. We did not hear any noise at all - either from the street or our neighbours. There is an outdoor pool and an indoor spa. My daughter used the spa and said it was great. The buffet breakfast, although not having a huge choice, had everything we wanted and the setting was very picturesque. However the best feature of this hotel is the location. It is walking distance to the city and most facilities and attractions. But it is just far enough away from the hustle and noise of the centre of town. The walk in the other direction is also very interesting. Public transport is very close. Overall we were very satisfied with our stay at the Marriott and we have already booked again for our next visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting experience!”
Reviews.Author: Stanleymaxwell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a five night stay at this hotel. There are many positive things to say about this Marriott................however!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! First of all - we arrived early in the AM after a LONG overseas flight from the US. We were pleasantly greeted, and were thrilled to get an early check-in to our room. The room was very nicely appointed, although as previous reviewers have mentioned, the hotel is older and a little worn. The couch in our room definitely had some threadbare areas. However, our king-sized bed was very comfy! Continuing on the positive note - we had a room overlooking Hyde Park. The hotel is in a beautiful and convenient location. Although it is about a mile from the harbor, we are used to walking, and enjoyed the exercise. This was wonderful for our needs - perhaps others might want to be located right on the waterfront. Public transportation is readily available nearby. We had no problem getting to most of the sights, once we became oriented to the area. Food in the hotel is pricey. Once we got our bearings, we were able to find nice restaurants, although it took a little bit of searching. Sydney is a very walkable city - once you figure it out, it is fine. Just a tip - take the exployer bus on day one (you pay for it and pick it up at circular quay). It is a good value and will give you an excellent feel for the city. On our last day in Sydney, we felt that there was quite a bit of activity and excitement in the hotel. We quickly learned that we were there for the day of gay and lesbian Mardi Gras. Our hotel was located literally at ground zero of the Mardi Gras parade. Prior to this, we could not figure out why we had to pay $310. for that night at the hotel! (our previous nights at the hotel were considerably lower in price!) I do wish that this had been explained to us when making the reservation! Anyway, one could be (a) comfortable in this situation, or (b) uncomfortable in this situation. Since we were there only as visitors from the US ,and there by coincidence, it was a very uneasy situation for us. The hotel did its best to maintain security and limit excessive partying, but a very "lively" atmosphere prevailed! Again - avoid this time in Sydney if Mardi Gras is not in your plans! I fault the Marriott Hotel for not explaining this in advance. I would give this hotel a better review if they had explained this to us, and if we did not feel gouged regarding our room rate for that night. Anyway - enjoy Sydney. It is a beautiful city to visit!

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: greenNYC
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Hotel Sydney proved to be the perfect hotel for me and my partner's four night stay in sydney in late Feb. I didn't initially choose it, as we booked it through priceline.com and you don't have the option to pick your hotel. However, this hotel is in the perfect location to see everything. It's across the street from Hyde Park, right around the corner from Oxford Street, a short walk to Darling Harbor, Pitt Street...we even walked back from Circular Quay one night. There's also a train stop just a block away, in case you're not up for the walking all the time (also convenient to hop on to Bondi Beach!). It's only drawback is that it's not brand new. It shows a little wear, but it's super clean, and the staff were always super friendly and nice. Our room, even though booked on priceline.com, was on a higher floor and had a terrific view - could even see the harbor. Oh yeah, as mentioned previously, the internet IS WAY expensive...but there's enough internet cafes around to use if you get desperate.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Marriott- pretty good, not perfect”
Reviews.Author: Tonya1
Reviews.Content: Just back from one night at the Sydney Marriott this past week. I generally like Marriott's so I went in with high expectations. First off, the location is perfect. Walk to the train, Darling Harbor, and Pitt street shopping. But, our first impression of the service was rough- upon pulling into the driveway, there was no bellboy to help with our bags. We waited a few minutes and I finally went in and had to ask someone from the front desk for help (they promptly came out to help us). Maybe we just caught them at a bad time but it didn't seem busy. Anyway, front desk staff was excellent and very friendly. The crib we had requested was already in our room when we got there. Room was pretty good size and the beds were super comfortable. We were on the 12th floor with a park view and couldn't hear the traffic outside at all. Next morning we did the buffet breakfast and again, had some spotty service. The servers didn't come around too often to refill coffee and the omlet station was only staffed for 5 minutes the entire time we were there. Also, for over $20/adult (if you didn't prepay the night before, it was much more expensive) I wasn't all that impressed with the buffet. Some of the fruit was just canned pears and peaches. There were no pancakes or waffles- I know I sound picky but you try breakfast with two toddlers in tow and no pancakes. Upon checkout, staff was again great and even offered to load up our car for us while we went for lunch. So, overall, pretty good but for the price ($330 AUD/night) I wouldn't say it was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, well positioned hotel”
Reviews.Author: wasamaid
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Marriott Hotel Sydney for two nights in late November 2007, occupying a large deluxe room with two double beds. Our room overlooked Hyde Park, and provided an excellent view. The hotel is well positioned to Hyde Park and Pitt Street, and is close to public transport, the monorail and numerous restaurants. At $171 per night (excluding breakfasts), I think that we got a good deal. Our room was exceptionally quiet, with no noise from street traffic or from other guests. Lifts arrived promptly on our floor and were never crowded. All features of our room were in good working order and were well maintained, and we particularly enjoyed the feather pillows. Our check in and check out were prompt, and staff at reception were very pleasant. We are from country Victoria and seldom visit Sydney. But should that occasion arise again, we would not hesitate to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: ArcherReykjavik
Reviews.Content: I could find anything wrong with this hotel except that I felt that the internet was expensive. The hotel is nice and clean. Staff is friendly. Breakfast is good. It would not hurt to upgrade the gym. I look forward to stay there again. Location is great!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view!”
Reviews.Author: hemikiwi
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed in the Sydney Marriot for 2 nights. It has a prime location next to Hyde Park and just around the corner from Oxford Street. George Street is only a short walk away too. I had a room overlooking the park and I loved the view! It was such a beautiful view to wake up to. Watching the sun set at night was also beautiful. I would definately request a park view if possible. The room itself was okay. A ittle dated with scratched desk. My bedside lamp did not work , but may have just been the bulb. The bathroom was spacious enough although lighting was a little subdued and I would have preferred it to be a little brighter for shaving. Unfortunately, the shower was a "you have to stand in the bathtub " type which must be problemamatic for people with restricted mobility as you either had to step into the bath which involved a step of at least 10 inches or onto a step at the side of the bath which itself was over 6 inches, and then step over and into the bath itself. Really silly design. The bed was very comfortable indeed with lots of comfy pillows! The TV was the usual "tv in a box" type but with lots of channels. Small sofa was nice but looked like it needed either a good clean or reupholstered. Lots of storage space and minisafe. Breakfast was included in my deal and was buffet in style. Over all the food was very average and definately not worth the $31 per person if you did not have it included in your deal. The view from the window was lovely though....directly opposite the park. My only "negatives"' about the hotel was in regards to housekeeping. I returned on a saturday evening after a very busy day to find that my room had not been cleaned. I had just bought some hot food to enjoy but instead had to wait over 30 minutes for my room to be cleaned. The staff were apologetic but after a long day it was not the best way to start the evening. Overall, a grreat location and wonderful view from room. Room itself was adequate but dated. Bathroom was large but I would prefer a seperate shower or no bath. Would i stay again? Probably but ony if a park view.

Reviews.Title: “Up to standard...Recommended”
Reviews.Author: auttapol
Reviews.Content: Me and my dad and my sister were there for 2 nights. We went to Sydney for an exhibition on September 24th. Location next to Hyde park not so far from George street and about 10-15 mins walk to exhibtion hall and Darling Harbour. Room could be a bit bigger and bed could be bigger too since there were 3 of us. Me and my dad had to sleep on the same bed and lucky that we were not a big guy so we didn't have much problem. Mariott standard so I would recommend to stay here

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Wellingtonian
Reviews.Content: We booked on priceline for US$127/night and stayed for five nights in August in a room with two double beds which accommodated our family comfortably. Check in was friendly and relaxed -- we made no use of the dining facilities or bar. The room was truly spacious, with a kitchenette (sink, microwave, kettle, toaster) and a fridge which was largely filled with minibar items (which we didn't use -- it would have been great just to have an empty fridge). The bathroom was generously supplied with towels and pleasant, lemonbalm scented toiletries, a ridiculously large triangular bath (so much for conserving water) and a well functioning shower. The safe didn't work but we didn't pursue it. We had a lovely view of Hyde Park, no problem with noise, a well adjustable heating/cooling system. The location is brilliant, just around the corner from Oxford Street, across the park from the Museum train stop, and plenty of food shops nearby (including a big Cole's in the World Tower). The 23d floor terrace has workout machines, a fine jacuzzi and a cool pool (too cool for swimming in August) with great views over the city. Would we stay again? definitely.

Reviews.Title: “good value with some minor issues”
Reviews.Author: Bo94114
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in a double double Excellent: Room size. Location. Good: Beds. Staff. Big bathroom with lots of counter space. Microwave and toaster. Minor wear and tear. New hallway carpets. So So: maid would not get to the room to make it up until 3:30-4:30p every day. Bathroom lighting. Fridge almost full with mini bar items. Bad: Nothing Solid hotel for a broad spectrum of travellers

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in this great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicksaab
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in October 2006. I found this to be a excellent hotel. I had a room on the concierge level with access to the executive lounge. The room was nice and the bed was comfortable. The staff were very nice and friendly. The food in the restuarant was very good. The hotel is very centrally located opposite Hyde Park, two minute walk to the metro station with direct route to the airport, five minute walk to the Centrepoint Tower. I have to give special praise to Simon, the concierge, without doubt the best concierge I have ever come accross and a credit to the Marriott corporation. I would recommend this hotel for both business and leisure traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with some flaws”
Reviews.Author: pam89
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in central Sydney on Hyde Park, next to Oxford Street. My room was large and with a nice panoramic view over East Sydney. The bad was comfortable. Broadband internet access in the room costs AUD 29 per day - too much, in my opinion. The bathroom was OK. It had a huge bathtub but the lightning was really bad and there was no heating, which made the bathroom terribly cold if you didn't leave the door open during the day. Service was friendly, but not perfect. I found a piece of plastic in my musli at breakfast one day and on my complaint the headwaitress just took the plate away - no excuse or offer to bring me a new plate! The breakfast restaurant is also too small for the size of the hotel. People had to queue for 20-30 minutes to get a table on Sunday. The hotel has a small gym with two treadmills, one stepper, one stationary bike and a multi-purpose weight station. The good thing is that it is open 24 hours, but it could be a bit bigger for my taste.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good facilities â€“ service not the best”
Reviews.Author: Peter_R_Smith
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here over the Mardi Gras week-end. We stayed on a â€œpremierâ€� level room and were given a room with a most stunning view over Hyde Park. The room was well furnished, well maintained and had some great extras such as micro wave and toaster. The beds were very comfortable with pillow tops on the mattresses â€“ a great nights sleep! The bathroom had a huge tub and a great shower with lots of water pressure. The hotel is located next to the park, close to the major shopping centres â€“ and was ideal for Mardi Gras, which runs down nearby Oxford Street. It has an amazing open air pool on the 23rd floor, surrounded by glass walls giving great views across Sydney. Service did, however, leave a great deal to be desired, The staff werenâ€™t as naturally friendly as I have experienced elsewhere in Australia. A call to get an ice bucket and ice took 3 calls and still didnâ€™t arrive before we left for the evening â€“ lots of apologies but just no desire to make things happen. â€œWe are very busy this eveningâ€� is an excuse not a reason!! Probably would stay here again, but there are lots of great hotels in Sydney, and for top end prices you do want the â€œcompleteâ€� package.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: craigking
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sydney Marriott for ten days in February 2007. The hotel is located on the corner of Hyde Park and Oxford Street. One could not ask for a better location. The staff is friendly and competent. The concierge staff are very helpful (particularly Simon); they made great recommendations for my excursions. The room was large, kept clean, and plenty of towels and toiletries provided. The furnishings were comfortable (great matress). The T.V. was crap, but who flies fourteen hours to watch television. There is a good restaurant with a great view of the park. By purchasing my air and hotel as a package, I did well at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: MagellanMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 16th to the 18th January 2007. Loved it and didn't want to leave. The bed would have to have been the most comfortable I have ever slept on. Both nights I fell asleep straight away as my head melted into the luxurious pillows (there was six pillows on the bed) and the lovely fresh crisp white sheets. I asked for a high floored room with a view of water and that's exactly what I got. The view was lovely. I could see right out to the Sydney Harbour Heads. I asked for an early check in (1030) and a late check out (1300) which they were happy to do and it was complimentary. The hotel receptionist at check in and check out (I got the same person on both occasions) seemed a little uptight. Very efficient but not very friendly and a forced smile. But apart from that I really enjoyed my stay. Great location and surrounded by transport options.

HotelInfo.Name: Sydney Marriott Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 36 College Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2010, Australia
